Summary: This is an older property that needs upgrading.  It was clean and the bed was comfortable.  The housekeeping staff folded the towels professionally!  The associate that checked us in was very helpful and knowledgeable of the area.

Summary Heading: Great Place Great Location Great Staff
Summary: Me and my girlfriend stayed a night this past weekend to have a beach day. David was amazing and went above and beyond to help us out with any questions or concerns we had. Give this man a raise and promotion. Very satisfied with our stay.

While a good location across from the beach, this hotel needs an overhaul. Our room, while clean, suffers from overuse; ripped screens outside + broken towel bar inside (which the owner decided to fix while we were unpacking). Everything in the room needs replacing. The furniture is old + worn. Absolutely NO amenities for our price of $165/night (Dbl Queen). It was quiet at night despite facing PCH. Will look for other accommodations during our next stay in OC. Definitely expected more for that price. It’s worth closer to $70/night.
Room tip: Easy beach access is the only plus. More hotels ( further north) would have a pool, etc for this...

Summary: I had booked a room here through AirBnB. I'll start with the PROS of my 3 night stay: The motel room was clean, had a TV, very good WiFi, a small one-cup motel-style coffee machine, a fridge, microwave, and hair dryer. The king bed was comfortable. It was a 5 min walk (one block) to the beach. I saw that you can borrow beach chairs and beach towels from the motel. There are 2-3 restaurants, a small grocery store, and 2 cafés in immediate walking distance. Not much else around in terms of sights. It's a 40 min walk to Newport Beach pier. It's definitely walking/bicycle friendly. The CONS: I'm a noise-sensitive person. The walls were very thin and you could hear the other guests throughout the night. I was on the 2nd floor (no elevator) and the AC generators were on the roof right

Summary Heading: SBK21 Perfect mini getaway for mom and daughters
Summary: We have stayed here before and it was amazing, family owned and cozy hot spot. I’m not going to lie when I found out it was under new ownership and new employees but... wow I was beyond impressed!! Great place to stay with family. I was in the big room with my daughters for their spring break this year and I couldn’t have asked for better service. Check in was simple and easy The rooms are totally accommodating for family trips and I’d imagine others for solo. But our stay was fantastic, we had the big room right next to the sun deck and the ocean is about a 700 ft walk (if that really)! Great place to stay happy they’re still open during covid. This place went above and beyond— my daughter got bit by something or stung at the beach and the woman at the front desk that evening

I’ve come here almost 3 years and it never disappoints. Rooms are comfy, there many good restaurants within walking distance and the beach is across the street.There is a nice rooftop patio where you can sit and watch the world go by. They have towels and chairs for you to borrow and the prices are very affordable. I highly recommend.
Room tip: I prefer a room facing the parking lot in front

Summary: This place was dirty & looked like it hadn’t been remodeled in decades. Rugs were totally worn & dirty. Curtains had holes in them. Air conditioner/heater blew up in middle of the night! Walls had holes & dirt on them. While the room was spacious & had a refrigerator, the unacceptable dirtiness/dinginess far outweighed the positives. In addition, the location was quite noisy with traffic sounds all night long & able to hear everything from adjacent rooms including the folks coming in at 1 in the morning. Horrible place to stay!

A family of four was subject to one of the worst experiences ever. Place in room 220 we were subjected to a couple verbally arguing for hours before the cops arrived.   After they were separated the room was left to be occupied by a mail who proceeded to be VERY VERY LOUD from 11pm to 5am the next morning.   After calling for the front desk multiple times with no answer we gave up.   No sleep....  The next morning we got up to go speak to the manager or front desk to find out the night manager on duty was the occupant of the room that was causing all the noise and altercations.   Lastly, this room is a safety hazard. Filled with paint cans, canvass and so much more filth this could have caused a FiRE or possibly an EXPLOSION.   Tried the owner with no luck!!!  Stay away!!!

HUGE Thank you to Miss C. & her fabulous  Crew at the NCI for three days of cool air, comfortable rooms that include nice clean bathrooms & up kept amenities....y’all Rock.  Rest, Relax, & Restaurants aplenty!

I have stayed at Newport Channel Inn every time I make plans to go to the beach. I enjoy the beachy atmosphere of the motel and the local restaurants which are walking distance. The beach is right across the street and easy access.  The staff is friendly and helpful every time. I love having a fridge in the room and microwave. You will love it.
Room tip: I've stayed in different rooms and all are clean and quiet

Summary: For the past 5 summers, my family and I love to visit the beach. When we do, we always stay at Newport Channel Inn. We love how friendly and welcoming the staff is during our stay. They are extremely accommodating with beach towels, chairs, and umbrellas. We love that there is enough beds to accommodate my family of five.The convenience of the parking and location to the beach is an added bonus.

Summary Heading: A hidden gem in plain sight!
Summary: Comfortable, clean and great location. Close to all that Newport Beach has to offer as well as the Huntington Beach surf scene. Very accommodating staff and parking is included!  Easy walk to the beach and Cappy's Restaurant for breakfast or lunch. Cappy's is an iconic local favorite.  We'll be back for sure!

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable, in a great location!
Summary: I’ve seen this vintage motel many times, over the years, as we’ve driven down the PCH. Finally, we decided to give it a try, and what a pleasant surprise!  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and really comfortable.  It’s so nice to have a fridge and a microwave in your room! The location is great!  Just across the PCH to beautiful Newport Beach!  3 or 4 good places to eat within a couple of blocks.  We totally enjoyed our stay!  Definitely going back!!

We were visiting Newport Breach mainly becasue we were going to The Great Pacific Airshow at Huntington Beach. This property was by far the cheapest in the area. It's location could not have been better, one block from an amazing beach. The room was large and clean and the staff friendly and helpful. We had booked to stay for 2 nights but extended our stay to 3 nights as we liked the area so much. Right next door is Cappy's restaurant, a great favourite in the area for breakfast and brunch. Next door the other a nice little general store sells all sorts of drinks and snacks etc. and just beyond that a great Italian restaurant, Spagetti Bender. A nice touch at the hotel was the free use of beach towels, beach chairs and childrens beach toys. A great place to stay, we would highly

Summary Heading: Nothing too special at the Newport Channel Inn
Summary: Pros: Nice, quick welcome. Spacious king room with coffee, fridge and table and chairs. Very clean. Convenient location for the beach, though we were just passing through.  Cons: Thin walls (we were woken by music and conversation in the room downstairs at 2am. There was no one in the office and no number to call to ask them to quieten down), and not a very comfortable bed.  I'm pretty surprised by all the glowing reviews - for $130/night I found the place to be very average value. I'll try somewhere else next time.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place, very clean and nicely updated, near beach
Summary: The hotel is right near the water (not on, but walking distance, a block or so) and near restaurants, and many activities are available in the area.  When we arrived there, the outside did not look overly impressive, but inside it was fantastic!  The place was incredibly clean, the rooms were obviously updated, and the service from the front office was fine!  The room had a coffee maker and a fridge.  It was well worth it, and we would definitely stay again!

Thank you Steve for making me feel at home. I love this motel so much. Very cozy, quiet, clean, very reasonably priced, and across the street from the beach. A+++ all the way and a well deserved 5-star. See you all again on my next vacation. Cya Michael

Traffic from the coast highway is loud and rooms need some updating but the proximity to the beach can't be beat for the price.  Big plus: They provide beach towels, chairs, umbrellas and boogie boards.

Wish we could have stayed here longer. Nice small motel very close to the beach. Free convenient parking. Nice size rooms with a fridge. Everything was neat and clean. Within walking distance of beach and restaurants. Loved the rooftop patio with tables, chairs and lounge chairs to enjoy the great weather and glimpses of the ocean. There is a park right behind the hotel. We felt very safe here. Extra bonus are the access to things to make your beach day fun and comfortable: beach towels, chairs, boogie boards and umbrellas. Great for those of us who are traveling light. Staff was competent and kind. Hope to visit here again for a longer stay.

Stayed here for the first back in February of 2016. When we decided to travel back to Newport Beach there was no question where we were staying. This quaint roadside motel is great! Family owned, completely renovated and meticulously kept. The owners are on site and very helpful. The offer beach towels, chairs, boogie boards and umbrellas for your use. They also have a spray off station so your room stays free of sand. This motel comes highly recommended!

Still my favorite form old schools casual beach motel. Eady room access, 1 minute from beach with supplies available. Walk to eats are awesome. Ditch the chains and bring your pals for one of the few remaining So Cal landmarks. One expect sThe Brach Boys tom show up and break off a tune or two.

Clean  big rooms cool staff  close to beach Affordable!! This place is the best  I had a long day & the staff helped me check in no prob i was hungry & they had grate recommendations fo good food close im glad i stayed here

Great location between Huntington and Newport Beach piers. It was exceptionally clean! The front desk person was helpful, attentive. One can walk to the beach across the road, the motel furnishes towels, etc and a place to wash the sand off. Parking tight but adequate. Good value, would return.

We had reservations for the Newport Hornblower dinner cruise and I was looking for an inexpensive place close by to stay the night, The Newport Channel Inn came up. I was really impressed with the price, the location and all the amenities , It was winter but I want to return here in the summer. Free beach towels and sand toys to use and there’s even bikes and a shower outside! The beCh is just across the street. The room was really spacious and had a fridge and microwave. There was a little playground near by and the BEST. Restaurant next door you can walk too. The staff was excellent. There is No elevator.  I LOVED this place a lot.

Summary Heading: Doesn't look like much - but was great. Nice atmosphere.
Summary: We decided to stay here for the night at the last minute - but after one night, we decided to stay for two nights. It's right on the main Pacific Coast Highway - but close to the beach. The road doesn't cause a noise problem, and we had a friendly and helpful welcome from Brad in reception.   The rooms are a good size, and Wifi strong (and free), and whilst basic - it is clean, and had a really nice atmosphere to it. We had three rooms on the 2nd floor (first floor for us Brits!) and it was pleasant to stand out on the walkway/balcony and watch the world go by.   This place was a surprise, and sensibly priced and very good value. The restaurant next door is brilliant - but I'd avoid the local store next door in the other direction.

I would be very suspicious of good reviews for this place. It made my skin crawl, although it looked clean. If you don't require any charm or warmth, then you might like it. Couldn't face another night there so I checked out early. Non-working hair dryer, non-working bedside lamp, no body lotion, no shower cap, scratchy sheets. Shampoo bottle had been opened and partially used. Room felt cheap and no frills. Teenager behind front desk couldn't provide much customer service.Yes, it's across the street from the beach, yes, they have boogie boards and beach chairs and towels.

We were meandering down the PCH swimming in the ocean whenever we got to some iconic beach. Newport Beach has always been one of my faves. I found the Channel Inn online and liked the reviews. It was just what I was looking for with its old-time charm. It's clean, well preserved, and the staff are all nice. The owner was definitely helpful in making recommendations for breakfast and for renting surf boards. The cleaning staff were friendly and efficient. It was a pleasure to visit there.  Our room was large, the king bed very comfortable, and the bathroom was really clean. The location was convenient to the beach. A short walk across the PCH. The beach directly across from the motel is great for surfing and body-surfing. Nice waves! The motel provided beach towels, chairs, and

I was looking for an inexpensive place to stay near the beach. This was perfect for me. Clean hotel room. Large room. King bed room. Easy check in late hours at front desk. I was on the second floor. Kind of hard to get a heavy suitcase up the stairs. Good tv. Good bed. The people below me had crying toddlers that I could hear through floor.  I liked the restaurant one building away that served breakfast.  I had eggs bend and mimosa. I also loved the bicycle rental place next door. I rented a bike for 24 hours for only $20. Rode across the street directly to the beach and to the pier.

What a great hotel! Short walk to the beach. Super friendly staff, boogie boards, beach towels, and beach toys available to borrow. Very good parking lot. Convenient location, right on PCH. Good price. STAY HERE!!!

This is a family run hotel with great service.  Rooms are adequate, but it is on the Pacific Coast Highway and is noisy.  The good news is they offer free beach chairs, towels, umbrellas and boggie boards to guests.  This is a great low cost place to sleep in a high priced city.

Good location but still not directly on the beach it is seperated by a busy highway It is a kind of basic motel just fine for a week end as backpackers. Very small bathroom not comfortable  Furniture old obsolete  Carpet old and dirty

We love staying here! This was our second trip, we stayed last year for several days and this  trip only one night.  The beach is a quick walk and the hotel provided chairs, boogie boards, towels. The rooms were large and very clean!  The hotel does not serve breakfast, however we dined at the restaurant, Cappy's Café, right next door and it was delish, and well priced for a family.  The sun deck is nice for coffee.  Traffic is heavy, but we really did not hear much as the rooms do not directly face the hwy like the BW next door.  Local guy next door rented us bikes for the day, he was very nice. Young staff was very nice and accommodating.  Thank you Channel Inn.

Spent the weekend in Newport Beach.  The place was clean, offered beach towels, chairs and umbrellas.   Close to the beach.  Nothing fancy but if you are planning on spending most of the time off property perfect place to just sleep.

Recently stayed here with my family. It’s been a few years since our last day and it definitely seems to have deteriorated. The room was dingy and in serious need of some updating, especially the carpet and bathroom shower. That being said, we would stay here again. The staff is friendly and helpful and the proximity to the beach is super convenient.

This is a great motel to stay the staff a very helpful and with free parking and free wifi the beach is just over the road and eateries within 100metres what else could you ask for, maybe fluffier towels

I would stay here again. This was a quaint little hotel that was super clean. The towels could have been fluffier, but that is the only negative I could come up with. There were plenty of towels and pillows in the king sized room along with the coffee pot, hair dryer and iron. Complimentary beach chairs and towels were available for the short walk to beautiful Newport Beach. No breakfast was included, but Cappy’s Cafe was two doors away. Excellent food there. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and accommodating. Uber’s were plentiful.

Very lovely little motel, check in was a breeze and we had such a lovely welcome, probably one the best we had in the states. Our room was on the corner around the back and it was clean and spacious. Parking is free and location is fantastic if you want to be close to the beach. Thanks Channel Inn!

Summary Heading: Incredibly convenient, wonderfully comfortable rooms, low price!
Summary: Right across Pacific Coast Highway from the beach, they offer free boogie boards & towels, and clean, comfortable, safe rooms with parking right beside the rooms. I spend lots of time at Hoag Hospital, and the 3-minute drive is fantastic. Every single employee has bent over backwards to do everything I wanted and more! I stay in the area frequently, and this beats every other hotel and motel I've tried. This may be the best thing: there are no dangerous, slippery bathtubs like the expensive hotels always have. Every room has a large stand-up shower - so much safer and easier to use!

Newport Channel Inn is a great place to stay at a reasonable price. It is about a half mile from the beach and a short bike ride from all the fun Balboa/Newport Beach happenings. The hotel has free parking and will supply you with beach towels, chairs, and other accessories. Rooms come in a variety of bed combinations to fit any family need. I was on a road trip with a friend and she liked it so much she booked it for a family spring break vacation.

Stayed here for NYE and was well within walking distance to all the bars and restaurants. The staff at check in were excellent and told us about all the nearby places to go. The room itself was spacious and clean and on par with some 3/4 star places we have stayed at. Would definitely recommend and would have been even better in summer time.

Stayed here with a group of friends for an event and couldn't be happier with my experience. We stayed one night, but the rooms were clean, roomy and reasonable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I know its family run business and it really had that feel, which was a good thing.   I really would love to come back with my kids and have a beach day. They had beach items to borrow and it was close to everything. I would definitely recommend.

This is an older establishment but clean. HOWEVER the housekeeping was less than satisfactory. Room wasn't made up until very late afternoon and received unsatisfactory answers when looking for answers to my questions regarding it.The location and it's proximity to the beach makes it an ideal place. And they do have lots of "beach toys".

Clean rooms and close to all amenities. Very friendly at the front desk and so helpful with suggestions on local places to visit and eat! Try The Crab Cooker, delicious!!! This Inn has great value for your money!

Stayed one night. check in was quick and easy. Staff was super friendly and knew where to access beach, restaurants and activities. Room was very clean and comfortable. We requested a rollaway bed and they made sure it was placed in the room ahead of time. Fridge microwave in room. They were very helpful by bringing extra blankets and pillows. They even help us open our bottle of wine when our  a corkscrew broke. Parking was FREE every else is more expensive and they charge $12-$50 for parking I would definitely come back with the family

Summary Heading: Like going to the family cottage
Summary: Right on PCH but traffic noise at night wasn't too bad.  Not fancy but served our needs.  Big room with three beds.  The hotel provides boogie boards, beach chairs, umbrellas and beach towels for a fun day at the beach.  Beach is easy to get to and there are restaurants and a little liquor store within walking distance.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  There is a big deck with a couple tables and lots of chairs

We had a room with 3 beds. This was great since my teenage girls hate sharing a double. The stay was great.  They have quite a few things they let you borrow for the beach which is nice.  Micro and fridge with a large counter was nice and saved us some money on food.  Everything was clean and tidy.  Parking was a bit tricky because we were in a truck.  You can walk to almost anything anyway. Lots of good food options nearby including Eat Chow.

What a wonderful place to stay!  First and last impressions, so they say, are what you remember.  From the friendly young man and sweet lady who checked us in, to the wonderful gentleman (owner?) who checked us out, our impression of this motel is:  you are WELCOME here!     The location is fantastic.  About a block in either direction is a crosswalk to get to the beach.  Beach towels and other beach paraphernalia are available to borrow to make your experience as pleasant and easy as possible.     We stayed in Room 102.  Our two queen beds were comfortable.   We had a microwave and mini fridge in a stand which made storing our snacks convenient.    Cool alert---there was a sliding barn door that provided privacy between the bedroom and sink area (which was outside of the

Cute little inn right across from Newport Beach (within walking distance)! The rooms are simple but clean, they also have a mini fridge and microwave for your convenience. The man at the desk, possibly the owner, was super nice and accommodating! He even recommended restaurants and things to do in the area. You can't beat the hospitality and location of this Inn, and for the price it's a steal!! Highly recommend ❤️

I had to go to the area for business from Northern California. This hotel is clean, updated rooms at a reasonable price. It is close to everything in Newport Beach. I had plenty of free time and went next door to rent bicycles. So simple and easy to go anywhere in the area. Thank you for an business trip which easily turned into a leisurely trip every afternoon.

Nice, reasonably priced.  Several Nice little restaurants next door, very convenient.  Right on the highway, but very quiet. Across the highway from the beach.  Proprietor and helper were very nice.  Very clean.

My husband & I discovered the family owned Newport Channel Inn a few years ago and this is our third stay here. It is a wonderful home base in a great location off the Pacific Coast Highway. The rooms are clean & comfortable. Boogie boards, beach towels & beach chairs (supply & demand) are available to guests to take to the beach, which is within walking distance! There is also a variety of affordable restaurants within walking distance, and a bike rental shop conveniently located right next door. It's a short drive to Newport or Huntington Beach piers where we saw both seals and dolphins in the water! Don't pass up this diamond in the rough.

This is the type of place we don't have much of anymore.  It is a motel in the sense that parking is near your room and rooms connected outside on 2 levels.  We were 7 people and got connecting rooms-2 doubles and one double with twin.  They were long and narrow with a sliding division one could use to separate the vanity which was separate from bathroom.  Beds were good but pillows not so great. Refrigerator. and microwave were handy as we picked up cereal etc. from store.  A large balcony with tables and lounge chairs made it easy for us to get take-out and eat outside. Street noise is not a problem for rooms toward the back.  The hotel provided chairs, towels and boogie boards which we used for the beach only a block away.  I wouldn't call this a  FUNKY place-only run by nice

This is my second trip to The Channel Inn and it can't be beat for the price. Great location right across the street from the beach and next doo to a liquor store (if needed). The rooms are always clean, a/c works great and pretty quite uri g both my stays. They hvae beaxh towels, chairs, and umbrellas needed for free use. Great lication being close to both Huntington Beach, and the Newport peninsula. For the price you should not want to go anywhere else.

If you are looking for clean,  friendly, no frills lodging, check this place out.  We had 2 rooms connecting with 2 queen beds in each room, there is a small fridge, microwave and table with 2 chairs. The beds were comfortable. They had a large sundeck on the 2nd floor which was great for just lounging or tables to eat. It was just a short walk (like 5 minutes) to the beach,  It was great they have beach chairs, umbrellas, toys, towels, boogie boards you can borrow at no additional charge.  Parking is included in the rate.  Would stay again if in the area.

The hotel was very clean.  Looked like it had been recently painted.  However, we listened to something vibrate on & off until 3am.  We think it must have been the washing machines on spin cycle. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Definitely bringing the kids next time!
Summary: I usually don't expect much out of a small, privately owned motel, but this exceeded my expectations. We arrived a few hours before check in and the (friendly) guy at the front desk hustled to accommodate us.   We didn't bring the kids this trip but will do so next time. The location was only a $5.50-$7 Uber ride from the bars on the peninsula. We came for the Coastal Country Jam and took Uber to Huntington Beach to eat first. (Quick, easy trip up the PCH.) The location was quiet, even though located on a busy road.   We had a single queen bed-the room was a little bigger than expected and was very clean with no weird odors. There'd be plenty of room for a blow up mattress and pack-n-play for the baby. There was a mini fridge, microwave, toiletries, hair dryer. The free wifi

For the area, this is nicely priced. Firstly, this is a motel - not sure that is clear. The rooms are definitely clean and comfortable enough but the rooms are older and there are no frills. The Rooms had a microwave, mini fridge and coffee station.  Nice TV with many channels and HBO. The soap and shampoo are a bit on the cheap side and not conditioner or lotion provided. Overall, for our overnight stay it was fine.   As for the beach access, it is not quite 'right across the street.'  Its about a 5 min walk and the Inn does offer the beach amenities for free - a nice plus for families especially.   Balboa island/Main Street both within 5-10 drive - easy to get to.   Finally, the parking is tight - both in # is spots and physical space. If you have an RV or oversized truck/SUV

The check in was great. The lady at the front was friendly and gave directions to local places to see.  She told of us of the "borrowing towels, boogie boards etc..policy.  I thought this was great they lend stuff for you to take to the beach.  The room was alright and hade everything we needed.  It was very reasonably priced. If coming back to the area I may stay again.

This is a clean, quiet, comfortable and affordable place for a weekend getaway.  Conveniently located within a block of two excellent eateries.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  Definitely would come back here again.

Summary Heading: Newport Channel Inn Motel clean and affordable and quiet.
Summary: Newport Channel Inn Motel is clean, well run, has lots of little amenities and is affordable. The Newport Channel Inn is a great place to stay and is located on PCH directly   across the street from a wide expansive beach. There is a small park with playground equipment for children right behind the motel. Little amenities include use of motel beach chairs, boogie boards and umbrellas. The motel's retro style means that the rooms are larger than more modern motel  rooms. It is quiet and convenient.

This is not a 5star but it's very nice and close to the beach.Very clean and Bradley the front desk guy was very nice and he made us feel welcome.We were very late and he called to make sure that we were OK and to let us know that there were no worries he would hold the room for however long it would take us to get there. I thought that was very kind of him because I wouldn't get that call from any of the 4 or 5 star hotels that we stay at.We didn't know what to expect from this place but it was very clean and nice.I would stay the there again.Thanks Bradley you are awesome

Been here many times. Easy access to rooms , parking and huge beach across street. Walk to cool eateries.( Cappys, Chow, Spaghetti Bender ) Kid, surfer and relaxed business types. Located on PCH, rooms are large and uncomplicated. Hotel staff are friendly and local. Nice to unwind here after business day on go into beach mode.

What a little gem for a quick overnight stay.  Very nice guys at the counter.  Dated, but super clean room and linens.  Quiet, easy and comfortable!  Thank you for making my daughter and I feel at ease when looking for a travel spot.  Easy to book on Trip Advisor

Summary Heading: Excellent Family place near the Beach
Summary: It was only a couple blocks to the beach - only negative was the incredibly busy street outside the hotel. We had a large 15 passenger rental van and couldn't pull into their parking area to check in, we were too tall. The only option was to back out and that was a near disaster. We had 3 rooms, two were adjoining, so we opened the door between for more a a suite. Housekeeping was great and the rooms were clean. The biggest hit besides the reasonable price was the beach gear we were able to use free of charge - beach towels, umbrellas, sand castle toys and boogie boards. The water was really too cold to swim but the guys did it anyway - coming from Northern MN, it felt great to be in 70 degree temps!

Great motel near the beach.  Room was ready early and very clean.  Front office staff was pleasant and helpful.  Cappy's next door was excellent and convenient.  Would definitely stay again and recommend.

This motel is just a few minute walk to the beach if that is what your for. The front desk will give you beach towels, chairs and even toys for the kids, so don't worry about forgetting anything. It is conveniently located just a few minute drive to downtown and walking distance to a liquor store and breakfast restaurant.  The room is clean, bigger then I thought.  It is not a 5 star hotel so remember that. But if your looking for a no frills basic clean room with a great location you will be happy.

Summary Heading: Funky Little Motel says it all
Summary: Have to agree totally with the 'Funky Little Motel' review.  Stayed here for two nights and initially wondered if we were going to like it.  There were plenty of car parking spaces and the motel is on the Pacific Coastal Highway, near to a Best Western so easy to find.  The room was large with a comfy bed and a clean, good size shower.  It also contained a fridge, microwave and coffee machine.  The staff were laid back, young and very helpful, assisting with local knowledge and kindly lent us a corkscrew.  Close by was Tony's Liquor shop which was ideal for milk,cereals and beer purchases.  Next door was a great independent bike shop, where the 'hippy- surfer' owner made a great change from the usual chains with an intimate knowledge of each bike he had rebuilt and a huge

Summary Heading: Extra days added to a conference Trip
Summary: Great value and location! Easy walk to the beach. Super clean accommodations. Comfortable bed, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, beach chairs and towels. Enjoyed sleeping with windows open to enjoy the coastal air. Definitely would return.

This place was so laid back and welcoming, one of my favorite stops on our 3 week southern Cali adventure.    The rooms were clean and spacious. They actually loaned out beach chairs, boogie boards, beach towels all complimentary. Yup that's right Free of charge!  Such a sweet treat to a family on a budget.  My kids and I had a fabulous time on the beach thanks to Newport Channel Inn!! Good eats nearby and plenty of beach.

This is the kind of place that grows on you.  If you are looking for professional polished and sophisticated go elsewhere.  The front desk guy looked like the ultimate beach bum grad school graduate.  The hotel is well entrenched in the local neighborhood which watches out for its own.  So the guys outside the lobby smoking and drinking beer are actually having supper with the front seek guy and would be the best protection you could ask for.  It just doesn't look like it at first.  The room is simple and clean.  Some stuff is broken, but functional.  The sheets are stiff but comfortable, the cleaning staff may or may not know English, but are very helpful.  Next door is Chappy's restaurant.  Go there.  The beach is within walking distance and the hotel provides towels, chairs

I stayed here after attending a conference at a "resort" in San Diego. I was so thrilled with this funky little hotel. We had a Queen/Twin room with a nice table, desk, microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator. The room was dated but clean! Check-in was easy and the desk attendants were friendly and helpful. Our shower was not draining properly but during the time that we went out for dinner it was fixed! The mattress was way more comfortable than the pricey resort one! There is a fabulous beach across the street and the Inn provides nice beach chairs, umbrellas and beach towels. I would definitely stay here again.

My wife and I stayed here for a couple nights recently. The room and amenities were nice, the staff was friendly, and the price was reasonable. Location was pretty good with the beach being right across the street. There are about 4 restaurants right there within walking distance too. The only down side is that the location is about 3+ miles from Balboa Island, which is a bit too far to walk. Fortunately there is a bike rental shop right next door, so we rented some bikes ($20/each for 24 hours) and rode down there. We had a great time on our Newport Trip and would definitely stay at the Newport Channel Inn.

Summary Heading: Quaint and clean. Close to the beach!!!
Summary: Stayed one night after 3 days at Disney. We had a tired 4 year old and were able to check in early. Room was sooo clean. We had a double and a twin bed room. I wish we had known they had beach umbrellas and towels and boogie boards, then maybe we wouldn't be sunburned today lol!!!  (Our fault) Can't wait to go back for a total beach vacation, and stay here the whole time!!! Thanks for everything!!!!!

This place was great! Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable- micro and frig. It has a great location, close to everything. I joined my husband on a business trip and had my own little get away here. Lots to see and do. The staff is efficient and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Found this hotel by chance after flying in from Pennsylvania on the first night of a weeks stay in California. Our other nights were already booked in Anaheim, but we had made no reservations for that first night. The Inn had rooms available when we called, was affordable, very very clean, and so close to the beach.  Would definitely recommend and stay again if I return to the area.

The best place in Newport for the price, but no breakfast. You can get that at Cappy's Cafe practically next door, and a bicycle rental place that is next door. Clean room with comfy king bed. Shower with grab bars [no tub] and chair-height-toilet separate from large sink area. Great WIFI that I believe was secured. They have available FREE beach towels, chairs, umbrellas, and boogie boards! And the beach? About a 1&1/2 blocks away! Lastly, the usual furniture with microwave and fridge/freezer.

A Travelodge sort of place, you know, 2 stories, linear, on a busy street, the Pacific Coast Highway, but it was fine. We're from New York, it was winter, it was fine. We had 8 nights & it was great to have a fridge & coffeemaker, microwave, a desk. Across the street from the beach, walk to restaurants, try it!

With some work near Newport Beach, I found this place just off Highway 1 based on a recommendation.  I was pleasantly surprised at location and with the room.  Location was central to food and night life as well as close to the water if your into that kind of thing.  Room was excellent for what I wanted which was a bed, as the towel rack did fall off the wall.  But WIFI was excellent in some locations, however not all over the motel so don't plan on streaming Pandora as you walk around.

Summary Heading: A Perfect Location Super Close To The Beach!
Summary: Me, my son, and my Mum stayed here for three days and three nights in the last week of April. I booked it about a month in advance and got a room (with a King sized bed!). The man at the front desk (the day I arrived, which was April 27th) was very nice and friendly. (I think he was the owner? He mentioned how the hotel was family owned.)The room was very clean. And I mean CLEAN. I've stayed at pricier and more "modern" hotels that are not even this clean. I really enjoyed the room. Had a great view. No noise problems. I have zero complaints. If I ever visit my homestate CA again & stay in Newport Beach, I am staying at Newport Channel Inn again. It's just a "hop, skip, and a jump" away from the beautiful beach. (Just go down a tiny block, cross the highway, and pass by a couple

The Newport Channel Inn is an exceptional family hotel. The rooms are immaculate. The staff are helpful and friendly. The accessible room is wonderful and beautifully decorated. The roll-in shower is perfect and the sink mirror can be adjusted, by the staff easily, for your convenience. The beds are comfortable and the air conditioning worked perfectly. The hotel is in close proximity to the beach (across the street) and a few dining establishments. It is centrally located to major theme parks and freeways. We had a delightful time and would definitely stay again.

This hotel has a great location, directly across from our daughter's home.  We were able to walk over each AM and we loved that the Channel Inn had so many beach toys for us!  We were able to use their beach chairs, umbrella, towels, and even sand toys for our grandson!  And when we wanted to get away from it all, we took a break on the Channel Inn sundeck!  Thx for a great stay, we will return!

Although I have used TripAdvisor a lot to determine where to stay, this is my first review.  I brought my family to New Channel Inn over spring break and realized too late that I had booked in April not in March.  Brion, I believe the manager, was quick to find us a room for the night in another hotel and then made accommodations for us at the Inn for the remainder of our stay.  He went above and beyond anything remotely expected based upon the circumstances. My family enjoyed the stay while there.  As the other reviews point out, the location is perfect for the beach, just a short walk.  We found the rooms comfortable and quiet.  With all the spring break vacationers, I anticipated some difficult sleep, but when we shut the windows for sleep, we slept without much noise at all.

For the last 10 years I have visited Newport with my Sport Education students from Norway, and everytime we come, we choose Newport Channel Inn. The service is always great and the price is affordable. The hotel is near the beach and we can park outside the room. Brion and his staff have always been helpfull. We appreciate the hospatality!!

The room was bigger and cleaner than we expected for a beach motel.  They have beach towels, beach chairs and toys available for guests complimentary. There is an area to wash wet suits as well.  The beach is a short walk.  Next door you can rent bikes and surf boards from a great guy too!  On the second floor is an outdoor area to watch the sunset.  We stayed one night with our young adult kids and would stay again for a quick beach trip.

Based on other reviews we booked this hotel for the first two of our four-day visit to Southern California.  I thought it was great.  The staff is knowledgeable and helpful, rooms were clean, and the price was right compared to other properties I was looking at.  They had boogie boards and sand toys that you could take to the beach. There is a bike rental shop next door and a great breakfast stop (Cappy's Cafe) next to that.  Walking distance the other direction is Eat Chow, which was fantastic.  Not sure why the hotel didn't recommend them for dinner/lunch.  Took Uber from hotel to Huntington Beach for $6.70.  Would definitely book again.

There are more elaborate hotels in Newport Beach, but, no greater value. The rooms are clean and more than functional. The room I was in had a flat screen TV, microwave and refrigerator. The air conditioner was powerful and the quietest of any I have encountered in any hotel. Beds were comfortable with four pillows each.The best feature is the location. It sits about a block and a half from the beach.They give you towels, beach chairs and beach toys to take to the beach. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable about the area. Find this gem.

I recently stayed at this nice little Jewel again to just chill for a couple of days at the beach and to ride my Motorcycle up and down PCH. Newport Channel Inn is a throwback, like motor inns used to be. It's super clean, quiet, very reasonable and 5 mins from water. The staff offers free umbrellas, chairs and toys for the kids to play in the sand. There is a top sun deck to relax and read while the sea air ruffles your hair. Next door is Cappy's a fabulous place to dine.

clean rooms and bathroom, great shower, comfortable bed. Easily accessible as on pch1. It was great for what I needed - I travelled from San Diego and was on my road trip to Santa Barbara. If weather was hotter then possible problem with no a/c. Staff lovely and towels and beach chairs available if you need.

I thought $110 was a bit overpriced for this ground-level room offering no cross breeze from the ocean.  The room was clean, but no a/c or ceiling fan.  The parking was really tight.  Folks were talking loud into the night just outside my window, but sometimes that happens.  Strangely, a cleaning woman at the corner upstairs unit kept dropping bagged items from the room to the ground floor making quite a racket for quite some time.  I only needed a nights rest, it was off season and no ocean view.  I felt it was overpriced.  The staff was very nice at check in though.

Read many of the reviews and agree....but NO ONE mentioned the sirens!! We're in room 202, just above the office, and EVERY siren that has come by SOUNDS like it's inside my room! Ugh. Thank goodness I have ear plugs. Other than that...very nice.  Even like the screen between the sides of the room. (See pic)

The hotel is easy on and off of pch 1. It is within walking distance of the beach. It does need some updating in the rooms but it is comfortable and serves the purpose. The staff is helpful.  If you have forgotten a beach towel or boogie board they have some there for guest use.

This is definitely a no-frills motel, but it's a great value.  The beds are really comfortable and the rooms are very decent considering how cheap it is.  Location has very easy beach access although it's a solid 1.5 miles from the main boardwalk of Newport Beach where bars and restaurants are.  This was perfect for a one night stop since we were flying out of John Wayne the next day.  Go eat at Mama D's if you stay here.

Stayed for 4 nights. Fine motel, clean and nice rooms. Very friendly staff. Good location  -  close to the beach. Free parking. Just outside the rooms. I would stay there again. Just a short walk to different kinds of good restaurants. A convenient place to stay!

We decided to try this old school beachside motel based in the reviews of others. We found that the other reviews did not accurately reflect how awesome this motel was!   It is family owned and operated. When you speak with someone there you are speaking to one of the owners and they care.   They offered great recommendations for everything from restaurants to entertainment. They offer the use of beach towels, chairs, umbrellas and even boogie boards and sand castle supplies!  We will definitely be back!!!

Many years ago a very close friend was the night manager here while in graduate school. I got in the habit of using the Channel Inn as a place to crash in Newport Beach, especially if I was sailing. It's a beach highway hotel, ( 2 block access) and is a little tired, but the location is excellent. You're in Newport Beach. An acceptable hundred dollar room is a bargain.

Stayed for 2 nights here while on a trip with a friend. This hotel is a hidden gem that needs to be buried again. Very old and has a damp musty smell in the rooms. The housekeeping does a poor job at cleaning the rooms. Bathroom cleanliness was not good. When the door to outside of room is closed you can see daylight which makes a person not feel safe in the room. The highway noise is so loud at night that we did not get much sleep.  Only plus to this hotel is its location by the beach.  You have to cross busy highway to get to it though. I will not stay here again. Waste of money.

This is a hidden gem with a great location, nice people and a good beach vibe. Reasonable rates and clean.. We had a slight noise problem from the upstairs room, but that wasn't the fault of the innkeepers. Good area to walk and beach is across the street. Good restaurants nearby.

Located two blocks off the local end of Newport Beach, this family run motel is a standard motor inn located on PCH. The motel has no amenities except parking and a deck upstairs. There is no view of the bech, but the sand is only 200 yards away across a busy section of local highway.  Although the ads say the motel was recently remodeled, we did not see any indication except maybe fresh paint.  The rooms had the musty beach smell. We endured the yelling of one of our neighbors in the wee hours of the night.   The motel does supply beach towels, toys and boogie boards - bonus!  The service was minimal and not at all helpful. I stayed here in 2000 and did not notice any real improvements in the last 15 years. Simple, clean and musty. I am giving this motel a three because of

Stayed here with friends on a trip to the beach.  The rooms are extremely comfortable, there is a patio upstairs to relax and enjoy the weather.  Staff is super friendly, and knowledgeable of the surrounding area.  If you walk 1 block north on PCH, and cross the road you are half a block off of the ocean.  They've even got a hose at the entrance to rinse the sand off before you go back in the room.  The location is great, being right on Pacific Coast Highway, and just down the street from the Balboa Pier area.  Its not too far, so its a great walk from the Inn to the bars down by the pier.  I will stay here every time I am in Newport Beach!

The location of this hotel is great! It is right across the street from the beach. The hotel will also lend you boogie boards, and other beach equipment. The hotel also has parking available for it's guests.  I will stay here again if I'm in the area.

We travel around California for 10 days, staying at different motels most night from San Fransisco down to Newport Beach.  This was definitely the best.  The welcome was warm, we didn't know much about the area and the staff were very helpful, our room was clean and better decorated than the other places we had stayed. It was handy for town if you don't mind walking, or there are cycle hire places next door.  We'd definitely go back anytime.

Summary Heading: a diamond in the rough right across the street from the beach
Summary: I went to Newport Beach, California for the first time last month.  I was pleasantly surprised at the accommodations at Newport Channel Inn.  The front desk fellow Michael, I think was his name, greeted me and allowed me to check in early. I had driven from Phoenix, Arizona so I was relieved to be allowed an early check-in.  The rooms are spacious and there is parking right in front of your room if you are on the first floor.  Restaurants and the beach are within walking distance.  However, within 2-3 miles there is everything you desire with a fabulous high end mall too which has movie theatres, Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen, etc.  I would stay at Newport Channel Inn again if my travels find me in Newport Beach.

Summary Heading: Great value, large rooms, and very friendly staff
Summary: My wife and I stayed here recently because our house was being tented for termites. We live very close to the Newport Channel Inn and my wife booked the hotel because of proximity and the low cost. I admit I was skeptical being a Marriott /Hyatt guy. But what a pleasant surprise.  The room was really big and nicely equipped. Free internet, coffee and comfy bed. The staff was super friendly and helpful. You can walk to several restaurants. We will definitely use this inn again and will highly recommend it to friends.

I stayed there for a weekend. Conveniently located to the beach, free parking in front of the inn and they even provide beach towels free of charge. Other equipment like bodyboards, beach chairs etc can be rented. Clean and spacious room, no frills.

Summary Heading: Best Little Inn on The Coast
Summary: Clean, Friendly, Affordable, Great Location. I am a neat freak, My room was spotless. They even have covers on both the mattress and box spring. The desk clerk spent some extra time to map places to see and eat. He really knows the area. A spacious room across the street from the beach for under $150. Close to the beach, great food, and shopping. They even have beach towels, beach chairs, and beach toys that you can borrow for free. We will defiantly stay here every time we visit the area.

Summary Heading: Great location and value...expect no more.
Summary: First off, let me say, I would stay here again in a heartbeat!  The location and value can't be beat.  The room was quite nice except for the layer of beach sand in the shower that needed to be dealt with before we could use it, the white towels that were pretty dingy and the fact that there were a bunch of fruit flies in the room when we arrived.  But, the sheets were clean and the bed comfortable.  Also, make sure you don't accidentally leave anything behind.  My boyfriend left his hat behind and called the Inn to say we'd be back to pick it up in the afternoon.  The person he spoke with said he'd tell housekeeping to put it to the side for us...but when we returned, apparently, no one had communicated anything to the desk staff or housekeeping and they had to retrieve it out

Summary Heading: Want a private beach without the high cost?
Summary: Visiting Newport for a beach experience? Look no further.  I needed a location that allowed my kids to walk to the beach while I had business meetings.  Perfect! They offer beach umbrellas, chairs, boogie boards and even beach towels.  Free parking and Wifi.  We stocked the mini fridge and brought an insulated bag to take snacks to beach.  We stayed in a room with 2 doubles and a single.  Storage is very limited for four people and their luggage.  The motel is tired, but clean and well kept.  (Hairdryer/coffee maker) Be sure to arrange ahead if you are checking in after 11PM as they go to bed.  My family will definitely be back.

The hotel could use a little upgrading, but overall it was fine. Rooms have small refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave. Near the beach. Helpful and friendly staff. Price was great compared to other hotels in the area. Good place for breakfast right next door.

Summary Heading: Great Family Friendly Quaint hotel In Newport!!
Summary: We had a great one night stay at this hotel. It is located on the north end of Newport right across the street from a quiet beach. This area is not over populated and a great place to visit and relax. The hotel has this nice family feel. They were so accommodating and had boogie boards, chairs umbrellas and towels for us to borrow when we went to the beach. If you would like an affordable stay in Newport and really enjoy what there is out there to do this is the place you want to stay great restaurants within walking distance. I will totally go back!

Great location and friendly outgoing family staff! Rooms are spacious and have everything you need. Microwave, refrig,coffee maker, table and chairs and nice flat screen tv and free wifi.  Free open Parking lot does not have security guard at night. 2 great restaurants within 1 block of this motel. if you want to bring your bikes into your room request a ground floor room.  We will stay there again!

This Inn is excellent. They are nice and quaint. They have everything you need to enjoy the beach and is loaned on the honor system. The rooms are clean and I was traveling with my daughter and we felt totally safe. We walked about 1/2 block to the beach. So worth every penny. We will definelty stay again.

Clean room but an old motel and the towels were very thin.  Stayed several nights and by the final night of our stay, the Kleenex box was empty and not replaced and we were given very few towels  - only bath towels and no clean wash cloths or hand towels. And the hotel is located on the PCH so it is quite noisy and the walls are thin as we could hear the people next to us.  The good parts - close to the beach and a cute breakfast place, Cappi's, that served very good food.  Would not stay there again, however.

Summary Heading: Not the Hyatt, but nice for the price.
Summary: I stayed at Newport Channel Inn for three nights in mid September 2015. I had contacted the property in advance requesting a quiet room. I was assigned room 235. The room was quiet and clean. The front desk manager was very professional and allowed me to check in early. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and did a great job. I really like the location and rented a bicycle next door. There is a also a small restaurant very close by that makes a mean breakfast burrito. I usually stay at Hyatt Newport and have stayed at the Holiday Inn Newport also, I liked this Inn better than the Holiday Inn and would stay here again.

older motel, was quiet and the lady in the front lobby was very nice and helpful close to the beach able to walk to it.  close to a breakfast restaurant and Italian restaurant. We were able to get into the room early which was a plus

We decided to stay someplace close to  PCH with easy access to the beach. This is it.  An older style setup but very very nice and clean. The staff is fantastic and will go out of their way to assist in any way. Free use of boogie boards, umbrellas, and plastic buckets and shovels for the kids. An all around great place to stay, close to other great beaches too. Russ and Lita Herd

We came here for a wedding in Newport Beach. This place was close to everything, convenient and nice. Room was very clean. Staff was very accommodating and nice. We were in walking distance to the beach as well as nearby cafes and restaurants. We would definitely stay here again.

Great little motel only a block from beach. Rooms were very clean and a reasonable price. Staff was very helpful in letting us know what was around the area for things to see and places to eat. Miles of beach which has some of the best surfing available in California.

My husband, myself, and our two young sons stayed here for two nights after leaving LA en route to San Diego. The inn is located right on Hwy 1. You will need a vehicle to visit Balboa and downtown Newport Beach; however, you will not need a vehicle to visit the beautiful beach, which is a two-minute walk away. Nice staff. Free parking. No breakfast.  Room was dated, but clean. Shower only--no bathtub. Bath towels are thin. Free use of beach towels, umbrellas, boogie boards, etc., which was great. Stay here if you want to visit the beach and are budget-conscious.

This hotel is in a great location, easy access to go towards Huntington Beach or down towards Balboa/Newport Pier.  The room was well equipped (coffee maker, refrig, microwave, hair dryer), the A/C was adjustable and quiet, parking right outside the room made for convenient packing and unpacking of the car.  They offer use of beach towels, chairs, float devices.  Bedding was comfortable, TV had sufficient number of channels to find something you like during down time.    The room was comfortable, had enough room so I didn't feel like I was in a cracker box, and even with my room being on a ground floor, I felt secure as a single female traveling alone.  I'll absolutely stay here again!

This hotel has the basic amenities, GREAT service, and excellent location.  Convenience, convenience, convenience!  Bike shop, surf rental next door.  Good local restaurants...everything within a walk away.

We stayed here on a family vacation and loved the proximity to the beach (just across the street - 5 minutes using stoplight to get across a somewhat busy street). The hotel is a nice, little, no frills place to stay. The staff is very nice and the rooms are very basic, a little on the dated side, and clean. It has a nice little feel to it as a beach hotel. The price is great especially if you are on a family vacation requiring multiple rooms. I would recommend this hotel for families looking to stay near the beach.

Location + !  Walking distance to great food and drink.  The staff is excellent. The accommodations are clean and well maintained. We stayed in a room towards the back and it was very quiet, overlooking a park and the estuary.  4 or 5 great restaurants within 2 blocks.  They have a great rooftop deck next to  PCH and the sunset is very cool. Check out Cappys for Lox and Bagels for breakfast and Spaghetti Bender for dinner.  Beautiful beach right down Prospect.  The amenities and the location were a great value for the price.  My wife was very happy about the coffee and the microwave!

Summary Heading: AMAZING LITTLE GEM NEAR THE BEACH
Summary: I decided to book this for one night prior to checking into our beach house since the location was literally 3 minutes from the house. This place was great. The staff was quick at check in, the rooms were very large, the bathroom fit 3 of us girls in the mirror doing our makeup with room to spare. The beds were comfortable. Only downside there are not alot of eating places near by for late night eating, but it's a short drive to beach blvd and other main streets. I almost am willing to just stay here next year for our annual beach house trip.. always a parking spot and can walk to the beach. The noise level was very low and the hotel was booked up. Would stay again!!!

Our first visit to Newport Beach. Loved that we could walk to the beach with the kids. The hotel had beach chairs, umbrellas and toys available for us. There is a nice park right behind the inn. Wish we could have stayed more than one night.

Summary Heading: Great location, great price, but smelly damp room
Summary: We had previously stayed at the Holiday Inn Express and loved that hotel, but this trip it was a lot more expensive, so we looked elsewhere and came across this one. This was the best alternative, but I wasn't that happy with the room. The carpet felt damp, I had to put my shoes back on and it had a urine smell. We left the door and window open whilst we settled in. The toilet did have yellow in it. Apart from that, the room was ok for a one night stay and was quiet which is what we asked for. It was a little difficult getting our suitcases up the stairs. I do recommend this place, but choose from what you are looking for and what Reviewers say.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us back in October of 2014!  Every winter we install new upgrades and improvements, and among the many we did since you stayed with us included replacing all carpet in every room and replacing every toilet with an upgraded new model.  Our new carpet upgrade gives us even more soundproofing than we had before plus a nice plush feel on the feet.  Besides all the repainting and other sprucing up we do every year, our other major improvements made in 2015 included replacing all of our older air conditioners with all new energy efficient super quiet models which all have remote controls for Guests to use, and we also completed a major upgrade of our free-to-Guests wireless internet access with the goal of 5 bars in every room.  We do not have an elevator, but if any Guest asks for help getting their luggage up the stairs we are always happy to carry them up.  This is our small family business and we try very hard to make our Guests happy and provide them with a quality experience and I would encourage any Guest who has any issue with a room to please let us know right then so we can figure out how to fix the issue right away.  Just like your great room tip, I would also encourage any Guest who might need a downstairs room to please tell us in advance when contacting us to make your reservation.  Certain room types are only located upstairs and others only downstairs so when making a reservation it is best for Guests to contact us directly for advice on room choice if you have a particular location need.  Thank you for rating us a 5 for location, cleanliness, and service, and I hope you have the opportunity to visit us again and enjoy all our new improvements!

Summary Heading: Excellent Place to Stay in Newport Beach
Summary: With such a convenient place right across from the beach coupled with nice clean rooms and an extremely friendly and helpful front office staff,  you can't go wrong with the Newport Channel Inn!  We arrived much earlier than the normal check in time and the gentleman at the front desk helped in getting our room ready earlier - we appreciated that.  The price cannot be beat for the quality of this smaller place.  There are good restaurants within walking distance too!

We stayed here for five days.  It was our first time to Newport Beach.  The room was very clean.  The bed was comfortable.  The Inn is old but very well kept.  The beach is about a two block walk.  The Inn has beach chairs and gear to use durring your stay.  It is a short five or ten minute drive to the Balboa Penninsula.  There are three restaurants within two blocks.  They are all good.  It is a great location in Newport Beach for the price.  I would have given a five star rating but the maid missed our room one of the five days.

The Channel Inn is just a short walk to the beach and within walking distance of three very good restaurants. The room was clean and spacious enough with comfy beds. The helpfulness from the front desk was a little spotty, but overall it was a very good hotel and I'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

This was a great find. Our room was nice and large and clean.  Comfortable bed with lots of pillows. The location is just a couple blocks from a very private beach. The hotel lends beach chairs, umbrellas, towels, toys etc. to guests to use at the beach. We tried three very good restaurants within walking distance - all recommended by the front desk employee at check in.  Try Eat Chow for breakfast for an especially good, and creative dishes!  I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when visiting Hope to come bathe Los Angeles area. Hope to be back soon!!!

Summary Heading: Nice location, not so nice service
Summary: We stay 4 nights over memorial weekend, they didn't make our room after 2nd night, and after 3rd night we had to request service b/c it was not done at 4pm when we returned to our room (were out from 11 am).

As a few other reviews have mentioned, the arrival is a little off putting. It is just off the highway and when we got there several rooms were being re-carpeted so the reception was essentially in the car park, however the staff were really friendly, knowledgeable and apologetic which is good enough for me.  The location is good for the beach, however it's a drive to the centre of Newport Beach (restaurants and bars etc) so you definitely need to have a car. Rooms are clean and comfortable (with new carpets!), with all the amenities you would expect of a motel in the USA.  I would recommend this hotel in Newport Beach, as it's good value in an expensive place.

So I admit I was a little scared when we drove up!  But what a surprise.....first I'll start with registration, the gentlemen at the desk was so pleasant and incredibly helpful with location, traffic detours and dinner recommendations.  Our room was in the back upstairs, very quiet overlooking a small park an very very comfortable, well appointed and had everything we needed.  We did have a problem with the A/C unit that Crystal went way beyond the call of duty to try and fix, she did offer to move us but we were so happy with the room, we stayed put.  I would highly recommend this property for anyone staying the the Newport Beach area

I brought a group of university students for a two-night stay at this hotel, and it was such a wonderful experience! The staff were more than helpful about meeting our needs and giving us ideas on different places to visit in the area.  It was the perfect location and right down the road from the beach! My students loved their time there and were very appreciative of being able to tour the area and be so close to popular areas, such as Newport Beach, Huntington Beach, the Wedge and more! The rooms were very clean and spacious, and we were able to utilize the sun deck for our group meetings and enjoy the view! Thank you again to the staff here!

Summary Heading: Clean comfortable quiet no frills lodging comes with some interesting amenities
Summary: Enjoyed my recent one night solo stopover here on my way to Los Angeles . Pluses:  1.	Spacious comfortable room.  Comfortable bed.  Quiet surroundings  2.	Friendly helpful staff.  After they sized up my interests, I was informed of the unusually high surf at the nearby Wedge  My visit there became the highlight of my visit.  3.	Beach chairs, towels, boogie boards, and sand toys available on loan  4.	Lovely public beach about  a 5 minute walk from the hotel  5.	Small park and playground for youngsters is  located across the street and behind the hotel  Potential minuses:  1.	Breakfast is not served here.  However, there are some excellent restaurants a short walk away along  the Pacific Coast Highway  2.	No bathtub in room 225.  No problem for me.  Nice accommodations.  Will

Stayed here with my husband for a 2 night getaway from the kids. Great price and easy walk to the beach. The room was okay. We basically just used it for sleeping, as we were out all day. Very basic room. We were on the ground floor, but we didn't hear any outside noise. The sink/vanity area is roomy, so it was nice to have space for getting ready. I didn't care for the shower. We had poor water pressure and the shower stall was very small. Overall it was a good stay. We might stay here again if we needed to stay on budget.

We stayed at the Newport Channel Inn over the weekend on a family to Newport for my grandfather's funeral. The hotel staff did a good job taking care of us. The rooms were clean, and newly renovated. The great thing about this hotel is location and parking. They also offer towel and beach gear loan outs! We had a wonderful time!

It's clean. Staff is friendly. Great for the price and the ocean is visible in the right spot and its only across the street. Beach gear is a plus and the rooms have a little fridge and microwave. Perfect getaway spot.

We are roadtriping from montreal around the us and have stoped here after visiting anaheim for disneyland. The beach is so beautiful and our stay at the channel inn so smooth that we have extended our stay from two to three nights. We are traveling with small children and love that there is a park right behind the motel and that beach towels and toys are free for borrowing. The motel staff are friendly, knowledgeable and go beyond our expectations. I can tell they are concerned that we have a nice stay here. Motel is super clean, room is spacious and rates competitive for the area.

Location Location !! A very cute hotel. Very clean, easy going staff. Kids park across their dead end road. Place next door called Cappy's an omelette with lots of real meat. We took what we couldn't eat back to hotel.. We had a fridge and microwave... Took 2 days to eat it all ! They have bikes you can use, too. I would so stay there again. One man was back there for the 8 th year ! FABULOUS PLACE FOR THE MONEY !!!!

Summary Heading: Great place, and love the fact that they have all the beach gear you need
Summary: Only stayed there one night when mixing a little pleasure with a business trip. We loved the fact that they had the chairs, and things we needed for the beach.  Clean, friendly place, and not expensive.  Would definitely recommend this place for a night or two if you're looking for somewhere not expensive and in handy for the beach.

This hotel is centrally located for restaurants, breakfast, nightlife. Is a complete package for family and solo trips. Is located @ 5 minutes walking distance to the beach. Very clean rooms in addition to the services at the front desk.

We drove from Palm Springs to Newport Beach without a reservation. We saw a deal for this hotel on trip advisor with a memo to call direct and save! We called and saved additional money. Glen was at the counter and was very helpful. We were trying to catch the sunset and were in a bit if a rush. He lent us beach towels and sand chairs and told us how to get to the beach just a short walk away. Perfect!  The hotel room itself was very clean. The bed was comfortable with nice linens. The carpet could be updated but everything else was fine!

This was a good place to stay considering the bargain price for the area.  The location is excellent.  It's a quick walk to the beach.    What I liked best was the easy availability to beach towels and chairs.  Parking is easy and convenient and free!  And the internet access worked pretty well and is also free.   TV was good and had HBO.  The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful and easy to deal with.  There is a rooftop deck which it wasn't quite warm enough to use but a nice feature.   The only negatives for our stay were - bathroom towels.  Tiny and thin.   Soon learned to keep our beach towels to use for showers.   Some noise.  We had a door in our room which could open to the next room.  We could hear a lot of our neighbors through that door.  This wasn't

We made some last minute changes in our itinerary and booked here last minute.  I have to say when we pulled into the motel i was very very scared by the look of things outdoors.  Our room was nothing fancy but was very clean and comfortable and had a microwave and small refrigerator.  This place is not super close to a lot of restaurants but the beach is literally across the road.  Was in a great location for us to head out for some cycling rides - very close to a bike path.  Great value for your money!  Front desk clerk was very helpful, offered lots of great information to us :)

I'm a hotel snob, but I was pleasantly surprised by this little motel.  I had to make a last minute booking b/c I was escaping a snowstorm in the northeast and my conference hotel was booked.  I could not believe how clean and spacious our room was - especially for the price.  We had dinner at Eat Chow (recommended by front desk staff) which was great and then the next morning we walked on the beach across the street and it was beautiful.  I wish I lived closer so that I could go back.  Great little family spot.

Summary Heading: Best hotel to stay at in Newport Beach area
Summary: Recently stayed once again at our favorite motel/hotel in Newport Beach.  Have stayed here three different times.  Our favorite because the beach is right across the street, close to every where that we want to go, always clean, and the friendly staff/owners. This time I made a big mistake by forgetting numerous clothes hanging in closet when we departed.  Brian, the owner, had all of the items shipped to us and received within two days. Outstanding service!!! This is the only place we will ever stay at when visiting the Orange County area.  Thanks once again Brian....Joy

Very polite, friendly and comforting. Older Motel but very nice & clean and right on PCH. I would highly suggest for a family or couple to stay and plenty to do in Newport. I'm ready to go back in the summer!

We recently stayed 2 nights at this motel. The location cannot be beat as it is right on the PCH and a short walk to the beach.  The room was clean and spacious along with all the items you need (microwave, refrigerator, etc.). They offer free parking, beach towels and boogie boards for guests.  We visited on one of the coldest days in SoCal so the beach was very chilly.  We will visit again when it is warmer so that we can enjoy the beach.  Overall, this is a great value for the area.  Whenever we travel we try to visit locally owned businesses.  This motel is a fun throwback to the past, with the amenities of today.

All the other reviews do not lie - it is wonderful for the price!  Such friendly people and the room was so clean and spacious and so close to the ocean.  I was hoping to be able to hear the ocean - its just across the PCH - but all you can hear is the traffic during the day - tonight we have our windows open and IDK if its just wishful thinking but Im sure I can hear the ocean!  My only complaint is about midnight the free wifi was horrible - awful lag - but considering all the pluses - that was so minor. (well for me - not my husband... lol)  Lots of plugs too!  I always take a surge bar with me for all our electronics - but didnt need it - that was an extra nice plus - also right next door is a little restaurant - Cappy's or something or other... very nice people there and

Location of the hotel is a short walk to the beach. The staff were very friendly. They offer free boogie boards, beach chairs and towels. The hotel is older but very well kept. Our room was clean and comfortable. I would stay here again.

It's not luxurious, but well priced for the area if you just need somewhere comfortable to crash.  There's plenty of parking, the rooms are nice and clean and spacious, and we found it to be quiet and had a good night's sleep.  The quality of the bathroom was very good and there's a fridge in the room.  There is Wifi.  Reception was pleasant enough and check in very easy.  No complaints and would stay again.

The staff here were SUPER FRIENDLY and they provide you with a lot information for entertainment and everything :) They also offer you boogie boards, umbrellas, towels and chairs for the beach that is right across the street- for FREE. You also get a discount on bike rentals for staying here. They have a park in the back of the hotel for children to play in. The hotel rooms here are pretty DECENT. It is not luxurious, its only a place for you to eat, sleep and shower. You will be out doing fun activities everyday anyway. This hotel location is right in the middle of everything -so nothing is too far. (Walmart, the mall restaurants). The only thing I have to complain about, is the rooms have a faint smell of vinegar. But I will definitely come back here to stay AGAIN! :) :)

Summary Heading: Depends on what you're looking for
Summary: The first two nights were great because there was no one in room next to us and all was quiet at night. Then the last two were horrible since the walls here are paper thin. We could here word for word what the people next to us were saying and they were the type that hung out until 10pm chatting up a storm and then went out for the night and came back around 2-3AM and did not even try to be quiet and actually were talking for like another half-hour at this time in the night. So if you're the party type or can sleep through anything I guess this is the place for you cause like I said the walls are paper thin. Another thing that we can't be 100% sure of but we think our 14yr old daughter got a fungus rash (as confirmed by a Dr) on her upper neck like where your head rests on a

Summary Heading: Good bargain but needs new carpeting
Summary: I debated whether I should give this place 3 or 4 points. I decided 4 points because for the price you pay a night, considering its location to the beach, free parking, free (although very basic) breakfast, and internet, it's the best deal you'll ever get in Newport if you're on a budget. The staff are polite. There are beach stuff you can borrow on a first come first serve basis. The room I stayed in was very basic - tidy, clean, comfortable, secure enough - but for some reason it felt humid the whole time I was there, even after turning on the AC and opening the windows. The carpet also really needs replacing. I felt so gross walking on it. I usually bring slippers when I travel but forgot. Call me a germophobe, but the carpet seemed and felt so old and worn, I couldn't wait

After much research and reading endless reviews we made the decision to stay in Newport Beach at the Newport Channel Inn. Wow. We were impressed not only with the attention we received at check-in but with the whole warm feeling. You were defientley  made to feel welcome. Directions and suggestions on what to see and do,beach towels ( use for free ) boogie boards, chairs etc. all for free use. Excellent restaurant next door Crappy's, and bike rental the next shop over.

This is a great motel.  It is older however it is immaculately clean and has all the necessities.  It is within waling distance of the beach, has a microwave, bar fridge, fast wifi, free parking and the staff are very friendly.  This accommodation was excellent value and I would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Out of the way and next to the beach
Summary: We were looking for affordable but within walking distance from a great beach.  We wanted quiet but not too far from restaurants and surf shops.  Newport Channel Inn was perfect.  The staff is super helpful, and the room simple but clean and comfortable.  The wifi was fast.  Parking was easy and there was a nice little healthy restaurant nearby.  Quick drive to the more touristy spots.  It was perfect.

Make no mistake this is a Motel. It's older & has a feel of motel that said its very clean & workers are very friendly & helpful. It's a great value for Newport Beach & nice weekend getaway. The beach is a short block away to a street light where you cross PCH to get to beach . Short 5 minute walk. The beach is mostly residential beautiful homes thus the actual beach is quiet..very nice! The motel has chairs, umbrellas & towels free to use if u needed. Although the motel is located in what looks like business area there are 3 restaurants very close 2 min walking distance ( Spaghetti bender, Eat Chow & cabby crab) they are plenty of other options if u want to drive.
