Fashion Island, balboa village & island are all a close 10-15 drive. There is a small park behind which is great

Summary Heading: AWESOME little gem!!! Southern Cali feel
Summary: I must admit I was slightly skeptic when I saw this hotel and compared the reviews, but was I ever wrong!!! This little place is an absolute gem. The staff was awesome when I checked in around 1AM. Super friendly and helpful. Hotels like this are a dying breed in the Southern California area. VERY happy with my stay, THANKS again for this great highlight of our trip!!! PS: you CANNOT beat this location, SERIOUSLY

I was looking for a hotel in the Newport area and struck gold finding the Channel inn! Great location for eating places, beach, and bike rentals. Everyone we met was very friendly. We got great recommendations from the staff on eating places and other attractions. The beach chairs and towels were a fantastic perk!! It was our first time to California and we would definitely stay at the Channel Inn again. Parking was not a problem either.

Recently, I stayed at the Newport Channel Inn with my husband and son.  We were on vacation visiting Disneyland and preferred to stay away from the park at the beach.  I researched several properties near Disney and Santa Ana (the airport we flew into) and settled on this hotel.  My decision turned out to be a very wise decision.  The location of the hotel was just a short drive to the airport and park.  It was also a very short walk to the beach.  Our room was just right for my little family and was priced reasonably (if not inexpensive.)  The room had a fridge and microwave, comfortable beds, and all the other amenities needed.    But what made this hotel so perfect for us was the staff.  I ask a lot of questions and they were always happy to help and give answers.  Glenn,

This place is awesome.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We had several family members coming from out of state, and some visiting from local areas so we decided to meet and stay at Newport Chanel Inn.  We were the hosts so we rented their largest room that sleeps 7 so we would have a meeting place for all our guests.  It was very spacious, clean, and it had all the necessities including a microwave and refrigerator. Several of our family members also rented rooms that were just as nice.  We used the sundeck to serve lunch,  There were plenty of tables and chairs and it was a convenient place to enjoy some sun, eat, and talk.  After eating we grabbed some of the umbrellas, towels, chairs, and sand toys that the hotel offers and went off to the beach.  It is just across

my wife and I recently stayed at the Newport channel Inn in Newport California and immediately were greeted with warm friendly faces.we were on vacation from Fort Worth Texas and it had been quite some time since we had seen the ocean. We got a king room which was very clean I like a really  nice shower the shower was awesome.the staff was helpful andcourteous right down to the maid service.it is an older motel with a more personalized service than your larger chains.The Sun Deck on the second floor was great sometimes just watching PCH is a show in itself I really enjoyed the sundeck it was very entertaining. You're just a couple of blocks from the beach walking distance and the motel furnishes you everything chairs towels umbrella ice for your cooler they were very hospitable

This place is great. Stayed on a Sunday/Monday with my wife and young kiddos (6 & 4) and we would stay again. The rooms are simple yet comfortable & clean. The complimentary beach toys are a nice touch and the beach itself is about a 10 minute walk from the Inn.   Mom & Pop owners, who are present yet not obtrusive (assisting housekeepers w/ laundry, backing up the front desk, etc.). Dealt mostly with Glen at the desk who was bright, informative and helpful. Great greasy-spoon type places within walking distance and lots to see and do within a short drive... a highlight for us (we're low-key, low-stress travelers who like to slow things down and explore) being a ride on the Balboa Island Ferry.   Excellent value and an overall great spot for good, clean no-frills family fun in

Summary Heading: I Almost Don't Want To Tell You About This Place, ALMOST!
Summary: DH and I are from Hawaii and have transplanted ourselves to the middle of the desert Southwest. From time to time, we take beach breaks and travel to California.  On this last trip, we decided on Newport Beach. In searching for a hotel, my husband came across the Newport Channel Inn. We couldn’t beat the weekday price, and the location, MAN! Walk two blocks down and two blocks over and there’s the Pacific Ocean that we miss so much. This property is not located in the hubbub of the piers, shops, restaurants and the boardwalk, but that’s okay.  We wanted to spend the majority of our time on the beach and away from crowds.   This place reminded me of the old style motor inns, very quaint and charming, not fancy though. We had a King room, which is equipped with a micro, `fridge,

Summary Heading: I left a Marriott to stay here and I wasn't disappointed
Summary: I checked out early from a Marriott property in Mission Viejo that was terrible.  I read the good reviews and wasn't disapponted.  For an older motel, it was very well updated.  Comfortable bed, nice flat-screen TV, beautiful shower with dual shower heads, and for being right on the highway, I heard absolutely nothing.  The staff was extremely friendly and the location can't be beat.  One of the best hotels for the price I've ever stayed at.

It is a motel, but great location. The room was updated/clean and parking included which is always nice though the car next to us must have had a kid puke in their carseat, decided to wash it in the parking lot and got stuff sprayed all over our car. Room came with a fridge/microwave. We have stayed in fancier chain hotels that don't incude the basics. Beach was across the street. Cafe next door, Cappy's,  that we did not visit. We only stayed one night heading down to San Diego. For the value, location, we would stay again.

Summary Heading: So great I rebooked for Christmas
Summary: Stayed here for a week and never wanted to leave.  What a relaxed, clean, privately owned, perfect location this is!  You go across to the beach at the cross-walk.  This is in a neighborhood of mainly private homes so the beach is not crowded.  This is a very clean, family oriented, upscale neighborhood.  But this hotel is reasonably priced!  I checked everywhere and could not get a deal or location any where like this one.  Next door is a bike shop with cruisers for only $20 bucks per day!  Surf lessons next door, too.  And wonderful restaurants including Pot Bellies Deli, The Speghetti Bender (truly authentic with a lovely indoor hidden wine garden) and breakfast at Cappy's.  This place is so good I really shouldn't tell anyone about it.  Has an upper deck where guests hang

my husband and i just needed an overnight stay while we were visiting Balboa Island, Newport Beach, and Laguna Beach over the weekend. we stayed in this Inn, it has all basic things that we need such as little refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. the room is very clean , the bed is comfortable as well as the shower. we will certainly stay longer next time we are in the area. last but not least, they provide free wifi and free parking.

There is so much to love about this little motel. I wanted an authentic beach experience, easy, carefree and relaxed, and this was perfect. The beach is a short walk, with a crosswalk to cross the PCH.  The rooms were large and clean, which is remarkable considering how much sand we tracked in, even after carefully spraying everything. Whoever cleans the rooms has a magic sand remover. There are several great places to eat very close to the motel. Our favorite was Eat Chow. (We ate there twice, it was so good). It is a short drive to the Balboa Pier and the ferry to Balboa island. There is a nice park right behind the motel, perfect for small children to burn off some wiggles. The one issue I had is that there was no place to hang our wet swim suits. For being a beach hotel, I

This hotel is great. Its just like the one at the end of the movie "Bedtime Stories." The owners are so nice and hospitable. They are accommodating and have boogie boards, chairs, and  all the beach things you could want---for free and the beach is right across the street. The rooms were clean and very comfy (the pillows are just the best) and there is a bike rental next door as well as an amazing restaurant across the street. Will definitely be back to stay here- such a good experience!!

Just stayed at this hotel & would stay again. Very close to beach & the hotel provides chairs, boogie boards, towels, & umbrellas. It is very convenient to Balboa, Crystal Cove & Huntington Beach. The staff was very friendly & helpful. We were traveling with a large group (11) and everything was great. Rooms are clean & updated. I would recommend this hotel.

We just returned from a stay at the Newport Channel Inn with our kids before they head back to school next week. I chose this hotel purely by the reviews on Trip Advisor. I do agree that the location is good, the parking was convenient and it was a quick 5 minute walk to the beach (you do have to walk across PCH but there's a light so it is ok).   We booked a room with 2 doubles and a single (we were 2 adults and 3 kids under 10).  I read on some reviews to ask for a room towards the back since the hotel is on PCH. When we were assigned room 111 I asked if there was anything further back and was told no.  Ok no problem.  I didn't find the noise of the street was an issue anyway and I liked that we were downstairs as I didn't have to worry about the kids stomping around and

We were visiting the area for the first time.  I was a bit apprehensive about the location, not being close to the piers and commercial areas, but this turned out to be a blessing.  Those seeking to be in the midst of the hustle and bustle of places like the Newport Pier will need to look elsewhere.  If you are looking for a quiet place to enjoy the beach, with a short drive to the action, then this is the place for you.  Located on the Coast Highway, adjacent to commercial and residential areas, you get the convenience of local restaurants and stores with the quietness of a place where people live.  The rooms are large, up-to-date, and clean.  The staff is pleasant and helpful.  Beach gear (chairs, umbrellas, bogie boards, towels) is provided, but can be in short supply (except

Summary Heading: Close to beach and price is RIGHT!
Summary: Have stayed here several times and most recently in July.  Staff is ALWAYS very pleasant and helpful.  They loan out beach chairs, towels, umbrellas, boogie boards etc.  Very short walk to beach which is biggest selling point.  The rooms are always clean and comfortable but if you want more than a motel setting then this may not be for you.  One thing I have learned after multiple visits is not to stay on the backside of the property that is closer to condos/apartments since it can get noisy in the middle of the night.  I will definitely stay here again.

While it is not on the beach it is a short walk across the street. Hotel provides towels, boogie boards, chairs and a few other toys. Front end staff and housekeeping staff very friendly and gave great recommendations for restaurants and surfing.  Room was standard size to slightly larger than normal hotel, and spotless. Refrigerator and microwave too. Liquor store/grocecies next door and bike rental shop, breakfast cafe on the other side. Motel let us use towels and beach stuff the day we left and also let us park our car in parking lot as we spent another day surfing and beaching it. Cant wait to come back...

Just spent 10 days at this location to recoup after surgery at Hoag Hospital.The staff was so accommodating and friendly. The price charged for this location was excellent. The beach is across the street and there is a great choice of restaurants within walking distance. We stayed in the newly remodeled Handicap accessible room and it was perfect for our needs. We will definitely stay again.

We stayed here for 3 nights, very nice. Great location right across from the beach and parking is Included, parking in the Newport area turned out to be a pain. We did NOT rent bikes but that looked like the way to get around. The hotel has beach towels/boogie boards/ a few chairs/umbrellas for guests to use for free. The room has 2 queen beds and the sink/bathroom area was quite spacious. This is not a luxury resort but it is by far the best value. I would go back again. On a side note: We ran into a few restaurants that only took cash, it was a little strange in this day and age that debit or credit cards not accepted.

Summary Heading: Our new go-to hotel in Newport!
Summary: This is absolutely our new go-to hotel in Newport Beach. We had looked at this place before but thought it may be too far away from the Crab Cooker.  Not at all. This location is actually far preferable over hotels nearer Newport Pier.  It is close enough to walk or bike all the way to the Wedge (Newport Harbor) but distant enough to be a calmer, cleaner area of beach and neighborhood. It’s also located just a stone’s throw from at least two fabulous restaurants. The previous reviews are spot-on regarding the terrific staff. We met three different people during our stay and they were all friendly, efficient and professional.  The hotel room itself was clean (most important) and surprisingly spacious.  AC worked great, water pressure was great and the toilet and shower are

Summary Heading: Best Price, Right on the Beach!
Summary: Love this place.  Right across from the beach.  It's a no frills place but very clean and nice staff.  There's a bicycle rental place right next door and we rented bikes for cheap.  24 hours for $15.00.  Also a great little restaurant next door serves pretty good breakfast.  Friendly atmosphere.

The room was very clean, and I am very particular on cleanliness. We had room 227 and it was very quiet and looked out over a little park. The motel is old but updates had been made. Only one block from the beach and plenty of restaurants within walking distance. This is a great bargain and sure to please families that want to spend time at the beach as they furnish towels, chairs, umbrellas and body boards. I would highly recommend for an affordable place to stay.

Perfect little hotel if you just want to stay at the beach in Newport without spending a ton of money. The hotel lets you borrow beach towels, beach chairs and body boards. A walk across the street and you are at the beach. Rooms are clean and updated. Ours had a microwave and a refrigerator. The hotel is located on busy PCH, so bring earplugs if you need them to sleep.

Summary Heading: Good value, nothing special but worth staying at
Summary: During one of my work trips to the west coast, I had a chance to partake in a little beach time on the weekend.  My friend and I decided to head down to Newport Beach to get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown LA.  My friend found the Newport Channel Inn for the night we stayed.  It’s located about a quick 5-minute walk from the beach and was a great deal at $159 a night (Note: This was the AAA rate, it would have been $169 otherwise.  Prices do vary as well depending on the weekend).  For a little motel on the side of the road, this little inn is a great value and a very good option if you’re staying in the area.  As I mentioned before the walk to the beach is 5 minutes, and you’re a 15 minute drive or less to the mall, Crystal Cove State Park, and plenty of

Me my wife and 3 year old son stayed for 3 nights last weekend and had a great time. It was my first time in Newport and the guy working when we got there I think his name was glen, this guy was the nicest person I've ever had the pleasure to meet. He was so helpful it was unreal. I mainly delt with him but the little time I had with the other staff was great as well. He new the area very well and helped us with dinner choices and directions. They had towels and toys for the beach all free. Also there was a very nice playground directly behind the motel. And there's a river or sorta behind also that had tons of crabs which my son loved. The beach is a really short walk and it's an awesome beach area not busy at all. The only negative thing I would say is the floors were a bit

I had a great experience staying here.  The location is fantastic, about a 4 minute walk to the beach.  The hotel itself is a bit old but nicely maintained for a place that gets a lot of salt air and - I imagine - stays pretty well booked throughout the year.  The staff were fantastic.  They seem to love what they do and are speedy when processing check-in paperwork.  I had to change my reservation to slice a day off the end and found them to be very accommodating, even though I suspect it might have resulted in a room empty that last night that wouldn't have otherwise been empty.  That's such a nice difference from the big chain hotels and that's what prompted me to share my happy thoughts about this hotel.  It's not the fanciest place, but it is clean and reasonably

I planned a visit to this area for myself and my husband, our 5-year-old grandson, and my sister. I had never been to the area, so I relied heavily on Tripadvisor reviews when making my plans. Based on reviews, I selected this hotel for its beach access and relatively low cost. I found the hotel to be clean and comfy, (though certainly very basic) and the staff very pleasant and helpful. The beach chairs, boogie boards, beach toys and beach towels available at the front desk were a big plus! It was just a short walk to the beach. The afternoon we arrived, we scurried down to the beach right away and were thrilled by the sight of a pristine beach, lots of surfers, and dozens of dolphins playing in the surf! My grandson had never experienced ocean swimming before, and he fell in

We've been staying at The Newport Channel Inn for over 15yrs and have never been disappointed.  It's always clean and the owners are friendly and helpful.  Every year they add or do something new to improve the place. They provide nice beach chairs, bogey boards and beach towels , just one less thing to pack. This year we stayed in their new wheelchair accessible room the shower & bathroom are to die for.  They have a nice size deck to watch the sunset.  Can't say enough nice things about this place recommend it to everyone I know, can't wait to go back.

This is a little motel across busy highway 1 from the beach. Nothing special but the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable and the location is nice. But the best part of the place is the folks who run things. Every imaginable toy you might need to enjoy the beach is available and the lovely folks at the front desk make this a very good value.

Summary Heading: Our go to place at the beach
Summary: My husband and I stay at this beach Motel every time we go to Newport Beach.  We were to attend a Wedding in Huntington Beach.  We could not even find a hotel in Huntington for the price, not to mention the location of The Newport Channel Inn.  We arrived arrived 11pm the night before our reservation and even asked for an extra room for some unexpected family members.  NO PROBLEM.. Room 117 in the back was quiet and close to the little park which was perfect for our 2 year old grandchild.  The rooms have a fun little divider between the bed and bathroom.  Nice privacy!  Since we brought our own chairs, we did not use the ones provided by the motel.  It appears they go early so get yours in the AM.  Beach towels are plentiful.  Cappy's is right next door and the Big Belly Deli

Summary Heading: Very nice reservation service by email and a Nice stay
Summary: We stay there for a week, and we ask for a room in the back, which is more quite during the night. The room size was excellent and the street noise was very low. It also have a nice view for a small park with privacy. During the day it was not so quite and nice because the room was next door to the laundry and we could hear the machine, radio and people sounds. The hotel is very well located to go to the beach and also to go to Irvine, Corona del Mar and of course Newport Beach. The reservation done by email works very well, and the staff was courteous and effective. In summary I would say it is a nice, safety and simple hotel with a very competitive price for the location.

Summary Heading: Good Start Ended with a Headache
Summary: We checked in April 1st around 4pm. Location is just across the street from beach access with a couple places to eat nearby. Front desk attendant was a younger guy with shoulder length hair, who was very helpful about letting us know about the nearby attractions and the hotels provides beach towels & chairs. Even when our vegas hotel charged me a $100 security deposit causing my credit  card to decline, he assisted me as best he could to figure something out. I slept well just cause I sleep deep but my other half had a little hard time because there's a certain noise in the middle of the night like someone's breaking into some door or what not from the other room. Not the Inn's fault though if it was the next door customers, just thought we'd mention it too.  Now for the bad.

We stayed there last September for one night with my mom and had a great time. Great price, they even give AARP and AAA discount.  Close to the beach and everything.  And they let you borrow boogie boards, chairs, umbrellas - what more do you need?  Oh, the bike rental is right next door ...  We're planning another trip back to CA this spring and after looking around, trying to find something close enough and affordable - well, the decision was easy: We're coming back!  Can't wait!

This is the second time in three months my wife and I met at this motel with my son and his two grandchildren in another room.  I understand from one of the owners of this family-run motel that the rooms have been upgraded within the past year.  The results are excellent by my account. The room is equipped with a nice sized table as well as a large desk. The former was used for meals with family and the latter for some work activities as well as play activities with the grandchildren.  The hotel staff are very accommodating and the rooms very clean and neat. The lbeach is just across Pacific Coast Highway about 300 yards away and quite uncrowded compared to Balboa Island. This is really a great part of Orange County to get away to the beach; good restaurants are within 2

Summary Heading: on the way to san diego
Summary: close to my home along PCH in Torrance,never had a bad experience here(stayed a few times) pros-good wifi,microwave and refrig in room,good location,parking,responsive and helpful front desk,close to food. cons-none

Summary Heading: Perfect Spot to Stay in Newport Beach
Summary: Just back from our annual stay at the Newport Channel Inn.  Wish we were still there on vacation!  Location is perfect for our favorite vacation activities: Disneyland and the beach.  The beach is a short one block walk.  Disneyland is a 25-minute drive with HOV lanes all the way.  After staying four nights, we then took a three-night cruise out of Long Beach.      Rooms have always been comfortable and wonderfully clean.  Love the new linens!  Ask the owners for a map.  They will go out of their way to make suggestions on where to go in Newport Beach or anywhere in the area.      You can spend a lot more and not have nearly as nice a stay.  Great location, comfort, and people equal great value!

The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly and very amazing. Everytime I go to Newport I stay here the view is amazing and super close to the beach and it's very clean and comfortable I recommend it to all of my friends and family

Very surprised to see any negative comment!  I stayed at Newport Channel Inn for a few nights in November and felt very welcome and safe! The staff was extremely friendly, my room was spacious and clean and the price was perfect for my tight budget! Thank you for your warm California hospitality!  I will be back!

The staff is exceptionally friendly.  The room was affordable and proivides the basics of what you need, but not a lot of added comfort.  This is a great place to have a quick overnight layover, but isn't a place that I would want to stay for an extended vacation.

Summary Heading: Economic, comfortable, all the amenities, and ideal for birders
Summary: You may think that because it's $50 cheaper than the motel up the street, it lacks amenities. But it had them all. The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable.  3-way lamps, daily maid service, Wi-Fi.  Three great restaurants, the beach, and an estuary where I spotted nine species of birds on a short walk are all within easy walking distance.  Plenty of parking!

My husband and I have been to this hotel a few times. We even brought friends because we enjoyed it so much. The rooms are clear and the manager is very helpful and attentive. The location is great if you like to be near more private beaches, which are just a 2 minute walk away. It's a nice bike ride to the main Newport piers, and a quick drive to the popular restaurants. We'll be back with the family.

I found this hotel through reviews on Tripadvisor and just stayed 4 nights here for the Christmas Boat Parade, and am so glad I did!  This hotel really exceeded my expectations in every way, especially for the reasonable rates, and I plan to go back.  Its location is very convenient, on the quieter side of Newport Beach and close to the beach.  I'd read that the neighborhood had looked sketchy and was a little concerned (as a single woman), but found it to be a perfectly safe area.   The room was very clean and quiet (I stayed in a back room) and had everything I'd need.  It was warm enough the first night to need AC, and that amazingly, worked well, was quiet and did not blow right on my face all night, like I've found in a lot of cheaper hotels.  Best of all was the warm,

We only stayed here one night because we came to Newport a day earlier than planned but we were pleasantly surprised by how clean and welcoming the motel is. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and the room was nice. Best part is that it is only one block from the beach! This is a great place for families to stay.

The owners were wonderful and really went the extra mile! The room was clean and intuitive. Small fridge microwave coffee maker. Comfy pillows and sheets. Traveled with 3 adults and 3 year old twins and a 2 year old...they had sand toys for the beach (just a short walk away) and beach chairs. Definitely would come back to stay.

Summary Heading: Clean rooms not so friendly front desk staff
Summary: I have stayed at this small older motel several times in the past it is relatively inexpensive and only a short walk to the beach.  This stay the room was clean, however the front desk staff are not very friendly and you often have to wait at the check in desk for someone to come out from the back living area.  Upon my check out at 8:30am not too early I found the front office door locked, however the little side door to the back office living area was open and I found several people all in sleeping bags passed out along with numerous empty beer cans. Apparently they partied all night and they were hard to wake up.  The only reason I wanted to be let in was the hotel offers cheaper tickets for Disneyland than you get at the park.  The man who came to the office was very

Stayed here 3 nights in September and it served the purpose of being in an area to explore.  We had a back room so it wasn't as noisy as some have stated and it was clean.  The guys/girls in the office were very nice to deal with and yes they were young but had some good suggestions for us on where to go.  Getting to the beach was a breeze!  There are a couple of restaurants within walking distance for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  If you want a cold beer sandwich or pizza I suggest Big Belly Deli that you can walk to.  The staff was great and pizza good.  You can grab a sandwich to bring to the beach.

We stayed here for two nights and had a nice experience. The staff were the very best part! They were helpful and thoughtful and gave us great suggestions of things to do and see. This is an older very basic motel, but if that's all you need it's a great place to stay.  The Good:  The Staff! The bed was comfortable The bedding was great, very nice quality Being able to easily borrow beach chairs and towels was awesome, especially if you fly Free Parking!! Closeness to the beach and good restaurants Very reasonable price   The Not as Good  We were on the first floor and had people walking by our room constantly and, while they weren't very noisy, the thin windows made it feel less than private.  Although we left our room for several hours in the morning, came back to rest for a

Summary Heading: great inn and great service for great price
Summary: This place was awesome! We booked a block of rooms for a family weekend, and the staff worked with us  all along to accommodate our needs!  The rates can't be beat, and the rooms are nice and clearn.  And it's under a 5-minute walk from the Beach!  Overall, great value - I highly recommend this place!  Miriam

Summary Heading: Disappointing stay... but manager ultimately proved very responsive
Summary: We stayed at the Newport Channel Inn on Labor Day Weekend.   We selected the hotel based on the positive reviews here as well as on the fact that my research indicated that this would be about the least expensive option for a family of four in the area.  Unfortunately, this proved to be the most disappointing of five hotels we stayed at during our recent southern California trip.  Some of it was bad luck and some of it was bad service from some of the junior members of the staff.  In a nutshell, our stay began on a Friday night that was literally the hottest day of the year.  In spite of that, the A/C was not on when we arrived, and the A/C unit itself generated only a modest breeze.  We went to the office, and the junior staff member came out to our room.  After about a minute,

Summary Heading: If you need a cheap place to stay a short distance from the beach, this is the one.
Summary: I am not one for flair and extras, so Newport Channel Inn was perfect for me. My room had a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and wifi.  The front desk lends out beach towels (and I think boogie boards and chairs, but I didn't ask).  They have cable with HBO (my room had a nice 40" tv.) The only downside (as is with most inns) is that the windows face the hallways, so you have some foot traffic noise, but it was off-season, so this was not bad.   I found this a great place to stay.

We choose to saty here each time we come to Newport Beach.  The small hotel is clean, efficient, and has everything you need.  The beach is directly across the main highway.  The hotel offers free use of umbrellas, beach towels, an chairs.  You can book a family size room or a smaller depending on the size of your group.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Clean Rooms and Affordable
Summary: We booked 4 nights at this hotel in August, not really thinking it would be up to the excellent reviews it gets. We were, however, pleasantly surprised: the room we got was spacious and had been renovated (new TVs, mirrors, showers, sink, etc), and the cleaning service is better than most larger and more expensive hotel.  Like the reviews we had read, the staff was polite and helpful, and after the first night we entered full-on "vacation" mode: stayed in Newport Beach the first day, walked to the pier and back, then drove to Huntington Beach (15 min North) the next day, and Balboa Beach (5 min South) too.  We used the bodyboards, chairs, towels provided by the motel (very nice!).  It was the perfect "home base" from where to visit all of the nice beaches around.  Very

Summary Heading: Location and Price makes it worth it
Summary: This is more like a motor hotel, with clean rooms and friendly service. The rooms are a good size, definitely not too small. The location to the beach and a few restaurants is perfect. The surrounding neighborhood is a little funky, but Cappy's next door is a fun friendly place to eat, with really good food. In fact, we had breakfast there 3 days in a row! If you are going with a group, the roof deck is a great place to meet up, look at the beach houses across the street, and watch the world go by. If you are looking for plush and room decks, this is not the place to stay. But if you are looking for location and low key, this place is for you. **There is a park right next door if you are travelling with small children.

This "inn" is a motel, complete with rooms bordering the parking lot. There was a lot of noise from the parking lot as well as the highway. The rooms are ok. The proximity to the beach is what you are paying for. Although it is nice that they supply beach towels and boogie boards and you can easily walk to the beach, parking does not seem to be too difficult and next time I plan on staying at a nicer hotel farther from the beach and just driving there. There is also so much else to do in that area that although we were travelling with kids we actually only spent one or two days at the beach during our whole week there. Also really missed having breakfast included. The restaurant that is across the way, Cappy's  is VERY crowded and noisy and not a relaxed place to wake up to. The

Seeing as this is identified as the best value in Newport, I had some expectations. Whenever the owner answers the phone or you talk to him......he is fantastic, helpful beyond measure and very kind. The kids he has working for him seem bothered if you ask questions and certainly arent going out of their way to help you, and God forbid they ever smile.Over the phone they were very helpful but the messy haired guy at the desk seemed downright annoyed that we came in the door. Sad, because I dont think that is the thinking of the owner. The room was clean but they never cleaned our room once we arrived so we didnt get clean towels or coffee for the next day. The location is great and the rates arent bad. Appalling for someone from the Pacific Northwest but ok for Southern Cali. I

You can't beat this place for location.  You'll wait longer for the light to cross PCH than it takes to actually walk to the beach.  You're in close proximity to Cappy's, a great little breakfast joint, and there's a combo mini-mart/liquor store on the way to/from the beach, that has everything you might have forgotten to pack.  The hotel itself seems to beg to be described as "no frills".  But then you take a step back, and tally up the frills:   Free use of boogie boards and abundant beach towels.  Even some beach umbrellas and cruiser bikes.  Every room has A/C, a big flat-screen TV, cable, free wi-fi, a refrigerator, and a microwave.  The ice machine kicks out the jams for when you're ready to head to the beach, and although parking is tight, there's enough of it.  That's a

Summary Heading: Good, but budget, place to stay
Summary: For the availability / pricing of this hotel, I was expecting nicer facilities. The decor, bathrooms, etc. are nothing to write home about, but they are definitely clean and reasonable (hence the 4-star rating). I would recommend this hotel for the traveler (single, couple, family) that is looking for a reasonable place to stay - just don't expect the world!

Summary Heading: Good value, close to the beach
Summary: We had prebooked a short stay at the Channel Inn as part of a road trip down the coast of California. It's a small old fashioned motel well located for the beach and the Newport Beach area. The accomodation offered is bsic, we had a two bed room, but the rooms are clean, pretty well equipped and the facilities are good. Our beds were comfortable, we had a microwave, fridge and air conditionning, and all worked well. The young staff on reception were very friendly and welcoming, we were asked if we needed beach chairs and towels, a very nice touch. There is plenty of free parking, and there two or three restaurants right nearby, but we did not use them so I can't comment.We ate at the 'Div' bar down the road, that was excellent and not dear. The motel is a couple of miles from

We always love it when you can find a great place to stay that is owned by a local family (and this one has been in their family for 40 years).  We are happy to help keep a small family business going, especially when they are such a friendly family.    This little motel is not fancy, but it is very clean and centrally located.  The grounds are well kept.  There is a frig, microwave and coffee maker in the room.  Most people want to spend their time out and about and at the beach, so this motel is more than adequate for making a good home base.       It is the BEST value you will find anywhere in the Newport Beach area.  We were thrilled to find it, as the hotels at the beach in summer can be so overpriced that it makes it nearly impossible to find a decent place to stay

My brother and I used it for an excellent value base for our Tour of SW US National Parks. Great location to recover from long flights - did my first swim (in my dreams surfing) in the Pacific just across the road. Spent a day touring Balboa marina area couple of miles away with advice (and discounted boat tickets) of the sites from Brion the owner. Lots of gen and help from Brad and his staff, much appreciated. General store yards away and Super Markets a mile. You could use the micro and fridge etc to cook, but why bother when 'Chows' (100 yards or less) provides some of the best food we found in 3 weeks. French fries to die for.......... - open breakfast to dinner. Super size double rooms with lots of handy aids with beach towels and chairs available, just asked. Delighted to

The Newport Channel Inn is in an excellent location, with efficient and friendly service.  This old style motor motel offers basic, yet up to date and clean rooms, and the bed was comfortable.  The microwave and refrigerator worked well and were clean. The staff is eager to provide anything you need.  It is a relaxed and family atmosphere.  This is by far the best value in the Newport Beach area.

Very good value for money. There was free parking, free beach towels and complimentary boogie boards.  The staff were all quite young, very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were quite big with 2 beds, tv, bathroom, AC, hairdryer, fridge and microwave. They werent anything fancy but clean and comfortable. A Great Find! Do not hesitate to book if your looking for a clean motel.  The beach was a 5 minute walk and is stunning! Great for surfing. With a Surf shop around the corner which rents wet suits and boards.  You can grab breakfast at this fab little place called EAT CHOW - great staff and lovely reasonable food.  Would definetly stay here again and loved Newport. You would have to drive from here to Balboa & Newport Pier and to get to the shops and main part but only 5 mins

We stayed two nights following a Disneyland visit to wind down and get some beach time. The best thing about this inn is the owners and service. They were real accommodating, helpful and genuinely enthusiastic with all facets of our coastal visit. The best bonus was the free beach towels, boogie boards, beach chairs and umbrellas that they loan to guests daily.  Visit Kevin right next door to rent bikes for a cruise. Just north on the next block is a small, locally owned general store with friendly service. The beach is just five hundred yards away, where you will pass Big Belly Deli, for some delicious sandwiches, at the Highway 1 crossing. *Bonus for families: There is a play ground park at the back side of the inn, which is great for kids to play on.

Summary Heading: Close to the beach and great service
Summary: I have stayed at the Newport Channel Inn every year in March for the past five years. Brion and his staff always give me a warm welcome and make sure I have everything I need to make my stay as comfortable as possible. I really enjoy the warmth and personal hospitality of this family run business. Even the maid service is excellent and accommodating. The Inn is located just a short walk from the beach, good food (try the Big Belly Deli for some outstanding pizza and sandwiches) and great surf shop (The Froghouse).   I truly recommend the Newport Channel Inn for those of you looking for a comfortable, affordable and friendly hotel.

We spent a week at the Newport Channel Inn for Spring Break in 2012.  Our room was not ready when we arrived, so we left, drove around the city, had lunch, and came back 2 hours later.  Were told room now had plumbing issues, so we were going to be put in a different room, and that room was not ready.  We then trekked down to the beach...a walk, but definately worth it.  Beautiful!  When we came back, another hour later, room was still not ready; waited another 30 minutes to check in.  When we finally got in the room, it was a large room (suite does not quite fit) with very little light.  We got in, started to get settled, and then were told our original room was ready.  We were given the choice of moving right then, or moving early in the a.m. as the large room was booked for

Summary Heading: well run hotel with attentive management
Summary: A buddy and I recently stayed at this location.  We felt it was a great value for the money and note the following:  -The check-in was handled by the owner of the hotel.  She was very helpful and suggested rooms that would quiet/optimal (noting that my friend did warn her that I write for TripAdvisor!).   -The property is essentially an old motel, like something out of the 60's.  However, the rooms are in good condition and the property is well maintained (they were having carpets cleaned and other work done when we were there).   -Normally, I do not like to be on the ground floor, but the room the manager suggested was on the end, and was very quiet.  Loading and unloading were easy.   -The room itself was functional and quite spacious - with a door that could be slid closed to

Summary Heading: good place to stay. Comfortable and good restaurants nearby. Beach access across the street.
Summary: we got a queen room that had a twin bed also. Room what's comfortable and clean.certainly not up scale but you're paying for location.and it is cheap for where it is located. Nearby restaurants are really good.

This was great find. Right off of Pacific Coast Highway and right across the beach from the ocean. Really happy with how clean the pace was. A sigh of relief when you walk in and see. Easy access to either Newport Pier area, Balboa or Huntingto Beach. Plenty of places to eat to enjoy the beach atomsphere are within walking distance. Can't wait to stay there again!!!!

My husband and I purchased new bicycles recently and decided to take them to the beach and break them in;) Since the weather was still so beautiful in Newport~ we searched for an economically agreeable stay as close to the water as we could pinch! The Newport Channel Inn is literally across PCH from the ocean. There are crosswalks to man in order to get there~ but so worth it!  First off...location.  As I searched for accomodations, I was literally scared of the costs of some of the 'beach close' stays. Serious money involved. I scoured Tripadvisor for something I might be able to afford. The Newport Channel filled the bill. This is a two story hotel/motel. Our stay was on the back side of the inn~ which I think was probably quieter than the front side where most of the parking,

This hotel was a great value.  It was located on a busy street, but our room was quiet and well appointed.  The hotel is a short drive from Balboa and the downtown area and just across the street from the beach.    The room and bathroom were clean and comfortable.  There was no breakfast available but there was a microwave and refrigerator in our room.  The front desk staff were friendly and accommodating.  They provided a map of the area and gave tips on points of interest, restaurants, etc.  When we needed help printing out boarding passes, they were happy to help us by letting us use their personal computer.    I would recommend this hotel as an affordable, comfortable, and clean option for staying in this area.

If you are looking for a place for the family, want to be by the beach and still work within your budget, this is a good place to stay.  The hotel provides beach chairs and boggie boards to enjoy with a one block walk to the ocean.  A number of places are around the hotel to eat a very good and affordable.  A park is located right next door for this kids that want to burn some energy.

I booked this property based on favorable reviews in TripAdvisor.  I was not disappointed!  Access isn't terribly easy.  As I slowed to turn into the lot, a speeder behind me leaned on his horn and flipped an obscene gesture as I was impeding him from going 75mph in the slow lane.  Score one for the friendliness of Newporters!  The parking lot is quite cramped; if you have anything larger than a mid-size car, this lot will be a problem!  I had received from Hertz a mid-size SUV and it was uncomfortably large.  Check-in was quick and friendly, although my 2nd-floor room overlooked a beat-up, skeevy-looking apartment building next door, which was located behind the smoke and tattoo shop.  Newport Channel Inn is in a gruesome neighborhood!  Room was lovely, quite large, clean and

we booked on line and were pleased with the hotel when we arrived, staff were friendly and very helpful, only criticism I ccan come up with is it could be nearer to the centre of town!!! Bit far for walking.

We stayed here during a winter visit to Newport. The rooms are clean, the service is great... they will tell you where everything is, and there are several casual restaurants nearby you can walk to. There is a beach access within walking distance, and they will tell you how to get there. There was a nice partition that you could pull across to separate the bathroom sink area, a nice little feature for some privacy traveling with friends.

Quiet, clean rooms near the beach, with great customer service and excellent value is a winning combination for this hotel.  While the beach is not visible from the hotel due to the houses on the opposite side, it is a very quick walk past them to get to the beach.   The front desk provides towels, boogie boards, and other assorted beach things to borrow, which is a great positive.  I probably would not have tried boogie boarding otherwise, though it turned out to be great fun!   The stretch of beach across from the hotel is top notch, with loads of clean sand and surf.

My 3 sisters & I spent 2 nights in a ground floor room (Room 104) with 2 queen beds.  We requested ground floor, because someone in our party had trouble with stairs.  The room wasn't huge, but there were 4 of us and we never felt crowded.  The room was clean and quiet.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  I left a note for housekeeping asking for extra towels, coffee, soap, etc. and  a generous amount was left for us.  I read the positive reviews before I booked it, but was still apprehensive when I pulled up to the motel.  It's not fancy by a long shot, but we just needed a place to sleep since we were out and about both days.  The front desk person was very helpful with suggestions for dinner & breakfast.  The owner helped us with directions & parking for the Catalina

If you like a quiet room very close to the Newport Beach this is the place.  Clean, facilities, flatscreen TV, Frig, and a nice shower.  Priced a little high, but worth it.  No drawbacks for a nice room in quick walking distance to the large clean beach.  But read carefully what you sign.  The exit price was a bit more expensive than what was discussed at the desk.  The sunsets and big waves helped me ignore the cost.  Enjoy.

I booked this hotel after reviewing tripadvisor feedback and after discerning that it was indeed one of the few affordable Newport Beach hotels/motels within close proximity to the beach. When we pulled up to the Newport Channel Inn, I was a little disheartened and worried because it's located between a liquor store and smoke shop. Not an ideal location. I was also concerned that the sun deck would prompt weekend parties until the wee hours of the morning. When I checked in, the clientele looked young and perhaps prone to lots of noise.  Thankfully, this turned out not to be the case. There were lots of well-behaved families staying at the Newport Channel Inn and the place was extremely quiet at night. The rooms were plain and not much to look at but were extremely clean. The

We booked this hotel based purely on the reviews from Trip Advisor. I gotta be honest, when we drove up to it I thought "Oh my Lord! What have we done?!" The place is not much to look at on the outside. It's old, extremely blue and plain looking and reminded me of an hourly motel that was near the home I grew up in.   However, that all changed when we saw our room. The room was so nice and very well kept. It is older, but has a really unique character to it and still offered modern conveniences. You could tell that it had been updated with new tile in the last few years and there were no cracks or crevices anywhere to be found.  It is also walking distance to the beach. Based on the reviews I actually thought it was on the beach and was a little disappointed to find out it was

This hotel is a gem for large families! My husband and I stayed here with our 5 grown children. We had a huge room which was clean, well kept and very inexpensive. It is an older hotel but well maintained. You can't ask for nicer people at the front desk! They offered directions and ideas that were all very helpful. Bought our Disneyland tickets from them and saved a lot of money. Some reviews talked about the street noise which we didn't mind. I mean, you are on a major road so some noise is expected.  Beach location is great too. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone.
Great Hotel - GREAT OWNER - Great Value.    Stayed here many times on business and recently with my family.  No better value in Newport Beach.

This was my second stay at Newport Channel Inn (I was also here last October) and this time I spent quite a while here! The owners are extremely friendly and helpful, cannot fault them. They were very accommodating when I requested my favorite room for the entire length of my stay. Rooms are very spacious, clean, showers good, with all the usual conveniences including microwave, fridge and large flatscreen TV. Wi-fi is available although my only quibble is that it isn't as fast as some other places I've stayed at and often cuts out. The location of the motel is probably it's biggest draw, close to the beach (a short walk across West Coast Highway) and the beach itself is great and clean. Behind the motel is a marshland and a cute kiddie's park, the neighborhood is safe and clean
We stayed at the Newport Channel Inn a few weeks ago and had a great time. The location is prime and the customer service was great. I highly recommend staying at this gem.

We spent three nighst here June 1st-3rd 2012, we are a family of five, kids ages 13, 11, and 8.  My kids wanted to spend their entire time at the beach, so it was awesome to receive free beach towels, boogie boards, beach chairs and umbrellas.  We used them daily and enjoyed our time at the beach!  It is a motel atmosphere, we parked right in front of our room everytime.  We did stay on the lower level and you can hear people walking overhead.  Overall a great location, just a short walk to the beach and great restaurants near by.

Summary Heading: Good enough to lay your head.
Summary: We only used our room to sleep. Maybe stayed in the room awake for 4 hours getting ready showering and stuff like that. Rest of the time we where out at the beach or sight seeing. The amenities are good. Fridge, microwave, pod coffee maker.  We had a 5yr old and 14 month old girls. Only a shower for bathing. My wife was really wrinkly after her 45 min shower taking turns with the girls. The coolest things about the hotel, they have beach towels to use on the beach. No sand in the rooms cause you just leave them at the front. The Cappy Cafe next door rocks for breakfast. And the Big Belly Cafe at the cross walk to the beach is also an awesome place for dinner.  It's about 5 mins away from the main parking for the Newport pier and ferry. The parking is really tight and if the

Summary Heading: A great place to get away!
Summary: We have stayed at the Channel Inn several times.  We love the relaxed atmosphere of the entire area.  The beach is the main reason we come but we also love the friendly helpful staff, the clean spacious rooms, and the family attitude.  The beach is literally right across the street.  It is also very clean and not overpopulated.  The hotel provides towels, beach chairs, and boogie boards too.  There is a great deli a few doors down that has some awesome salads and sandwiches.  Shopping is close and the movie theater at Triangle Square is amazing.  We have rented surf boards and wetsuits at the Frog House a few blocks down for a very reasonable price.  Bike rentals along the beach are also a great price.  The staff is so helpful with ideas of things to do in the area, maps,

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Newport Beach!
Summary: I've been to Newport Beach many times, but just recently stayed at the Newport Channel Inn for the first time.  I can definitely say I've found my favorite hotel in Newport! For the price I couldn't have asked for anything more.  Its right across the street from the beach with great restaurants really close by(I highly recommend the Big Belly Deli and Cappy's).  The woman that checked me in was extremely friendly and very helpful. I know the area pretty well, but she was happy to pull out a map and talk about new restaurants and things that have gone in since the last time I had visited Newport. The front desk was happy to call a cab for us when we were ready to head down to the pier area and overall the service was just great.  The room was very clean and spacious as I see

I stayed there this past week for 5th or 6th time and, like always, it was the perfect trip. We always seem to walk out of the office with a warm feeling at the end of our trip. It's not a particularly posh, hip or very stylish place to stay, but for the money, it's perfect. The house keepers are always on the ball and I love asking the front desk for a restaurant recommendation because they love giving me like ten different options. Parking has never been a problem and the location is right across the street from a huge beach.  Simply put, it's great value.

Summary Heading: Never again. Definitely let down by previous reviews.
Summary: I read many review prior to booking Newport Channel Inn. For the price and good reviews, at that time #5 out of 17 hotels in Newport Beach, I thought hey why not. I've never stayed in a motel...I regular Holiday Inn or other moderate chains and wish I would have on this trip too. We arrived on the Tuesday after Memorial Weekend, the parking lot empty. The guy that checked us in did give us a map and highlighted locations that might be of interest and was very good. Our room wasn't ready so we had to come back....We came back and got into the room. The room is like many say below...spacious and simple. The fridge however took forever to get cold, but finally did. I however really just don't feel comfortable in this room. The biggest pro is the location, you can walk across the

My husband and our 3 small children stayed here for Spring Break in April. The staff was very accomodating.  Girl at the front desk even mapped out the "go to" spots in that area for us upon check-in. Our room was spacious and clean.  It also included a microwave and mini refrigerator. Huge bonus when you are travelling with small children. Sleep rating is average due to my children waking me in the night.  Outside noise was minimal to none. Great location for the price. We made family memories of a lifetime while in Newport Beach and Newport Channel Inn exceeded our expectations. My husband and I are returning with friends in July.

My family and I checked in VERY early in the morning and were given the friendliest help despite waking the onsite manager. She was prompt and just awesome, got us a room that had plenty of beds (without rollaways!) Was bummed they didn't have cribs but normally bring the pack-n-play so no worries. It was a great last minute choice and will definitely stay again! The price was great for the location and the kids loved walking a couple blocks to the beach. It isn't fancy but isn't priced that way and felt more beachy than a chain motel. Also had a short trip to Disney and Knott's without the hassle of staying right next to the parks!

Summary Heading: Avoid it despite the low rates
Summary: Stayed here 2 nights and NEVER again! The office closes at 11 pm but the managers are on site. Unpleasant and made me feel like they were annoyed whenever I asked anything, like the password for the WiFi as a small example. Yes, there is a beach two blocks behind the property but it is unsavory; the location is the very north end of NB. I asked for directions explaining that I needed a couple of landmarks rather than the compass; she insisted on the latter, returned to her room where I could clearly hear her laughing at my bad sense of direction which I had acknowledged from the beginning. A family with 3 young children who had travelled for 18 hours were met with a closed office, unanswered knocks on the managers' door. It was 10:30 pm.  Eventually someone came out snarling

Summary Heading: Organized surprises are the best such as birthdays but in my hotel ................not.
Summary: The group:  me, wife and 85 year old father-in -law.  Reserved place memorial weekend.  Other places booked....this wasn't..........first warning.  Manager .... Interesting.   Hand wrote my purchase of room on paper.   Charged there .... Gave no receipt.  Free wi-fi .......  Password didn't work. After looking at the networks available ... Stay off may be compromised (my opinion) toilet stuck, needed to jingle the lever to stop the bubbling up.  "Oh the humanity" 2 2x2in. Holes in  my bed spread (wife pointed out the other one) ouch this hurts. Now for the up side. 3 beds,  good T.V., close to ocean, frig, micro wavy, clean ( bed spread and coffee maker so so)  cost one night 168.00 w/tax.   Over priced, really worth 100.00. I would invest my fianances elsewhere. Oh, the light
Our room was spacious, clean & comfortable and we appreciated the fridge, microwave and flatscreen tv.

We stayed here for 3 nights (2 couples) as part of our 2 week road trip on the west coast. What a great place and real value for money. Free wi-fi, which is also handy and great restaurant (spaghetti bender) and cafe (cappys)!right next door. Would stay again !!!

This is a  motel type building.  I was glad it had a small refrigerator and microwave. but everything was pretty ordinary and simple.  Its close to the beach but not close to the shops or pier.  However the man in the front does give you lots of information with his maps of the area and discounts on activities in the area.  Good breakfast cafe next door.

I only stayed one night, but what a nice place! When I arrived the cool guy at the front desk asked me if I wanted the map tour. I said, "Sure". He took out a marker and started marking different locations. He told me about some really cool places to visit and talked about some of the local hot spots. He was very friendly and knew Newport Beach really well. The inside of the room was clean and the bed was comfy! It was just a tad expensive for the age of the hotel I thought, but it was right across the street from the beach!

No complaints here, the room was very nice and clean. Just be prepared for road noise if you get the room over the office. Had a little park behind the hotel with a playground the kids loved. Also short walk to beach and channel for exploring

We stayed here for 2 nights and no complaints!  Very clean, spacious rooms. Lots of bathroom counter space and storage space. Slept great.  It's right off the main road and not in the middle of town, but that didn't matter since we drove everywhere.  Staff was nice and helpful, price was right, and internet connection was excellent.

I've been staying in similar hotels for the last two weeks and this is by far the cleanest and friendliest so far. Clean and spacious rooms with fridge and microwave, overall excellent experience. The internet connection could be a bit faster though :p

Summary Heading: Lovely little place in beautiful location
Summary: After spending a few nights in a simarly priced and filthy motel in San Diego, I was a bit nervous that this place would be below average.  I couldn't have been more wrong - this little hotel / motel is an awesome find.  First thing that struck me on arrival and continued for the duration of our stay was how attentive, friendly and lovely the staff were - each and every one of them.  Location-wise, this place was perfect for a few days relaxation in the sun as it was literally across the road from the beautiful Newport Beach.  The rooms were large, comfy and clean.  I'd definately recommend this place 100%.

We stayrd at the Newport Channel Inn for a weekend getaway to the OC.  The hotel is cetainly not fancy, but that is not what it is trying to be.  What it is, is an old school, super clean and convenient hotel. The location cant be beat, only a short walk to an absolutely stunning beach.  Huntington beach is only minutes away and a great place to see.  The dog beach was a blast even though we didnt have a dog.  Balboa Island is only a shory car ride as is Laguna Beach, all wonderful places tp spend a few hours or a day.  The theme parks too are only a ahort drive so you really do get the best of all worlds.  We highly recommend the Newport Channel Inn.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for the budget traveller
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights on a recent mother/daughter trip. We had a room with a queen and a single. The sink, outside of the bathroom, had a huge counter to spread out toiletries. The bathroom had a shower only, no tub.  The bathroom/sink area had a huge sliding door, so that it could be closed off from the bed area (a little strange, but handy when changing). The hotel is older, carpet a bit worn but was very clean, well maintained and in a great location. We felt the location was very safe. The owners were very friendly and helpful with information about the area. The hotel is 2 blocks from a gorgeous beach and  has lots of parking. Being on  the #1 meant it was easy to get around the area. The only negative is that the single bed was much harder, not as comfortable
What a find! Great location. Just minutes from everything. No view but is across from beach. Cute little park behind hotel.  Great price for Newport Beach.

This is my third visit to Newport Channel Inn, and I DO love it.  It's older, but you can't beat the price, the room is spacious, the TV is amazing with tons of channels, remote control heater/a/c, great location, amazing helpful staff.   I'll come back, but I will say two things bugged me this trip.    We stayed for five nights.  We had a nice room at the back of the hotel, which was quiet.  Parking as always simple and easy and free.  Free wifi is great.  However - after staying three nights at the Tangerine Hotel in Burbank that had AMAZING comfy beds - Channel Inns were not as good.  Which is ok.  What was not ok for me is the fact the bed seemed to sport a rubbery-plastic mattress protector.  It was under the sheet.  Now, I get the desire to keep the mattresses bed bug and

Summary Heading: Comfortable beds, very clean room, nice parking, close to beach and nice houses
Summary: Very friendly female taking phone reservations, quick and friendly check-in. We stayed on the second floor. This is an older property, yet it is very clean and well maintained, has very comfortable beds, air conditioner, big flat screen tv (with easy to use simple remote control), smaller type fridge, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, closet, table and chairs, plus a desk. Slow but free Wi-Fi is included for all guests. Rooms had new thick double pane windows to keep any outside noise out, and granite counter at sink area.  We had room with queen and a single. Our room was small, but very comfortable. If you are feeling closed in and need to get away from the family, there is a nice 2nd floor large patio with chairs + small tables, or a 5 minute walk to the beach, which is
This hotel its awesome, clean, comfortable and spacious rooms, friendly staff, and really close to the beautiful Newport beach. This gonna be my choice when i come back to Newport.

Based on reviews on Tripadvisor, I booked two rooms for Thanksgiving, 2011. It is an older motel, BUT it is so clean, has large rooms, and refrig/micro in rooms. The parking is free.  The staff was wonderful:  our husbands wanted to check in early like 10:00 to 11:00 to watch football. I was told to call at 8:00 am the day of to see if rooms had been used the night before.  One was ready and one needed cleaning, but when we arrived the staff really went the extra mile.  And the coffee kits had really good Columbian coffee. Yes, ask for rooms near the back to avoid noisy street.  Almost next door is Cappy's Cafe, which serves huge amounts of food on each order.  We split a sandwich and could not finish it! Breakfast menu was amazing.  We plan to stay here next year!

A fully appointed spotlessly clean room across the street from the ocean in the heart of beautiful Newport Beach, the Newport Channel Inn offers stall showers, a new plasma TV and parking outside your door.  I will certainly return when I'm in the area and I cheerfully recommend it to anyone.

Stayed here for 2 nights on a girl's USA roadtrip and were so glad that we chose this lovely little motel.  Only 5 mins across the road in the beautiful beach and the hotel provide beach towels which are returned to a bin outside reception to prevent the rooms from getting covered in sand which was great.  We had adjoining twin rooms on the upper floor which were really large with 2 very comfy double beds in each.  It was great to be able to open the doors between the rooms and made it feel almost like a laege apartment.  Decor was slightly dated but for the price was fine and the rooms were very clean.  The reception staff were lovely and full of great tips on where to eat, drink and best sights to see in Newport.  There is a small sundeck on the roof which was lovely.  There

Had a great four nights stay here! Rooms were spacious, clean and welcoming, with beautiful new en-suites. Staff very helpful and went above and beyond to help us out on any queries. Directions, maps and suggestions on attractions and lovely places to eat in the area provided by the staff were extremely helpful! Perfect location, 2 minute walk to the beach and only a short distance to the beautiful main town within walking distance to local amenities and a few restaurants. Must recommend the picturesque boat tour round the Newport Harbor and chocolate dipped frozen bananas! Free wi-fi, complimentary beach towels, coffee facilities, fridge and microwave all in the room were ideal! Couldn't have asked for a more relaxing, fun filled stay...thank you for making it a perfect visit

I spent a week at Newport Channel Inn and can highly recommend it. First, the rooms are immaculately clean with no signs of wear or tear, the reception staff are friendly and helpful, often giving tips about the area. There is a beautiful beach just across the highway (literally 5 min walk from the Inn) so extremely convenient for popping back for lunch or a shower. The Inn offers complimentary beach towels and coffee, there is plenty of parking space. If you're into fitness walking or jogging as I am there is the river close by where you can run up one side on a cycle trail up to the next bridge and then come back the other way (takes approx an hour). Also behind the hotel is a nature reserve which is worth visiting. The hotel also offers free wi-fi. I had a very relaxing time
Great location, excellent facilities, very helpful and friendly staff. Really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend it to everyone.

Can not fault this hotel. Rooms are very clean and nicely presented. The staff are very friendly and go that extra mile to satisfy guests e.g. they have boogie boards for guest to take to the beach which is just over the road. Had a lovely relaxing four days and really enjoyed staying here. Thank you Newport Channel!

Summary Heading: Good beach access and value, too
Summary: My daughter, son-in-law and 1 yr old needed two hotel rooms for a fast trip to California for a family wedding. Because it was August, we wanted to be able to take advantage of the beach inbetween all of the family reunion and wedding activities.The Newport Channel Inn is simple looking, very basic, but couldn't be better located, clean, economical, supportive staff, and lots of amenities in a high-priced district. Easy walk across PCH to Newport Beach. Inn provides you free beach towels, umbrellas, chairs, boogey boards, and a footwash station upon return. Simply furnished rooms but they have a microwave, refrigerator, hairdryer, coffeemaker, HD TV, free wifi. FREE PARKING.A great base of operations for busy travellers. Well located for trips to Newport and Balboa and

Summary Heading: Wonderful Stay...excellent customer service & awesome location!!
Summary: My sister and I stayed here with my nephews, ages 14 & 18.  We stayed near Disneyland for three nights, then stayed at the Channel Inn for two nights so we could be close to the beach.  The boys can be a little picky, so they were a little unsure at first.  But they ended up LOVING this motel!     I had stayed here once before and was very impressed with the location and service.  The inn is right across the street from the beach and a short drive down Highway 101 to Huntington Beach.  We walked across the highway every day and took a nice walk  through the neighborhood and down the beach walk to Newport Pier.  We found many interesting shops and restaurants to keep us busy.  We also spent a nice afternoon on the beach across the street...very CLEAN and beautiful!!  The customer

Summary Heading: it was OK for 1 night stay
Summary: We stayed for one night and had a corner room on the 1st floor. When we first entered the room, it smelled funny, like cleaning detergent or probably from the carpet. The smell went away the ff morning or probably our noses got used to it. Room was clean. There is only one sink, no sink inside the bathroom, stall shower, there is a sliding door for privacy between the bed and sink area.

Summary Heading: Place was fine - clean, comfortable, and a short walk to the beach.
Summary: The Newport Channel Inn is a beach motel. It is basic but clean and comfortable. The rooms are good. The bathroom and shower are clean. They have parking. There are many restaurants within walking distance.They have a nice deck to sit on. There are refrigerators and microwaves in the room.  They have beach towels and umbrellas in the office. It is not fancy but it is a fine place to stay. I think for the area, it is a good value.

did alot of research to find a nice hotel for my hubby's birthday.  this was a quaint place within walking distance of the beach.  great in january cuz i'm told its less crowded and the weather was very nice.  rooms were clean - quiet room and easy parking.  staff was very accommodating to us - definitely would stay here again.  had a blast  - between newport beach and huntington beach so you are not limited to fun in the sun.

Very nice, Staff and maid service. Room was good-but we were on the run all the time. Cappys Great breakfast, but pricey. Another place is good just North you can walk. They also have "boogie boards", chairs, besides the towels at the hotel.. You do have to cross Coast H'way(1) and they FLY on that road-just be careful-Granny would not make it!!!. Parking on site. Staff was always cleaning and sweeping grounds. If you want to go to movies it is Edwards Theater chain-VERY nice (but pricey) take Coast H'way SOUTH left on AVACADO movies(3) theaters -about 15 mins away. Movies are accross from Macys big mall there. Balboa pier is much nicer than Newport Pier. Plenty of parking there-you pay though about  1.50 hour- quarters/credit card. I beleive the street is Palm street( (Balboa

Just spent a night at the Newport Channel Inn.  Coming from someone who is VERY picky about staying in hotels, I booked a room because of all the good reviews it got on here, and I have to say we were not dissapointed.  This place is so cute and sooo well kept.  First of all the staff is very friendly and very helpful.  The rooms are very well kept and clean.  The bathroom was so clean, and the price is great!   And you get free parking and free wi fi.  I have stayed in expensive hotels that don't give you free wi fi.   Right accross from the beach.  The location was really clean and nicely kept.  Very nice neighborhood.  There is a cool restaurant next door called Cappy's that has great breakfast and good atmosphere.  A short drive away is the ferry to Balboa Island and Balboa

If you want to be close to the beach and don't care about the frill's of a nice hotel then this will do just fine. The staff is friendly and helpful which is why I picked this place. Our room was small and absolutely no frills, but clean which is most important to me.  We just wanted to be close to the beach without spending a lot of money.

We are repeat customers of this inn. I wish other establishments would duplicate what they have done here. Affordable lodging in OC with restaurants nearby. The ocean is just beyond the cross walk across PCH. Make no mistake, this is no hotel, rather it is  a great place to stay if you do not want to shell out a ridiculous amount of money to stay in the area. I like that there is a mini fridge and microwave in each room. Rooms are not overly fancy but bathrooms are clean and you get free parking & wi-fi. No need to bring beach towels as they provide these for you and you drop them off when you are done with them. Exceptional breakfast at Cappy's next door.

This hotel was very nice for the price.  It is across the street from the ocean and very convenient.  Free parking, coffee.  The people at the front desk were so nice.  We wold go back again.  We made coffee and went up to the deck in morning and sat outside.  Everything was very nice.

I really enjoyed staying here.  It was close to the beach, clean, friendly staff, and a great value.  It was nice to ask directions to the grocery store and Downtown Disney and get to where I needed to go without any difficulty.  I'm from Oklahoma and live in the country.  The cars going back and forth on the highway at night just lulled me to sleep.  I will come back again.

Summary Heading: a great stay in newport beach without the high price
Summary: across the street from the beach, located near many restaurants, clean, comfortable, what else do you need? we had a king room, very spacious with a fridge, tv, table and chairs, separate vanity area from toilet and shower.  it was clean and quiet.  the carpet seemed a bit damp but giving the location i am not surprised.  it didn't have any odor, just felt humid. pick up beach towels at the office, drop them off when you're done.  faucets for rinsing sand from everywhere so you don't track it in. a great place if you want to stay in newport beach and can't shell out hundreds per night.

Summary Heading: Second Visit, and will be back!!!!
Summary: I stayed one night last September and vowed to be back!  My husband and I just stayed five nights at the Channel Inn.  It was by far the cheapest hotel on our trip, and in the best location, and the best service.  We stayed in a hotel three times the price on the beach in Monterey and did not receive the value we did here.  Yeah, there is no pool.  For people with kids, this may be an issue, for us, not a problem.  We used it primarily as a base to tour around OC and see the Newport Boat Show.  Front desk dude was super friendly with awesome, bang-on advice on where to eat.  Room was clean, updated, and well appointed.  Noise is an issue, some guests were not polite when coming in at 1am one night, but this is hardly the Inn's fault.  Also, road noise, but it isn't unbearable.

the crew of my movie stayed here for the local film festival and were treated like kings.  the first night i was there i asked the guy at the front desk to call me a cab and instead he gave me a ride to my destination.  Very nice people who have all the answers to any question about newport beach.  Also, they have a great patio for hanging out!

Summary Heading: Great location across from the beach
Summary: Great value Inn with excellent helpful staff. We stayed 11 nights to take advantage of the Beach, shopping, & Disney. Well located across the road from the beach, with 2 mile walk to Newport Pier and 4 mile walk to Huntingdon Pier - both great walks with stunning beachfront properties. Inn is basic but given we only slept there it served our purpose. Great breakfast cafe next door - Cappy's, with 2 good restaurant coices a short walk from the hotel - Royal Thai Restaurant and Alessa Italian restaurant. the only thing we would have liked was a pool and maybe some beach chairs to take to the beach, which other motels have provided. We have stayed at newport Beach previously - the Hyatt but Newport Inn was both better located and better value.

This was a great little budget hotel in a very upscale Newport Beach location. It is literally a walk across the street from the beach. The customer service is awesome-so friendly and helpful. My only negative is that it's a bit out dated and the beds are not really comfortable. I also HATE those old, plasticy-type bed covers. I think they are dirty and gross so I would have preferred to not have that on the bed. BUT-it was clean, convenient, and overall a great value. I would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay for the budget traveler
Summary: Our room was very comfortable.  The staff was extremely helpful and sent us to a wonderful place to eat!  Convenient to the beach and easy parking!  We loved it and will return.  Don't be deceived by the outside.

Summary Heading: Great little gem and the price is right
Summary: My first trip to Newport Beach and I searched around a bit and decided to give the Newport Channel Inn a try.  I was a little unsure - the price was great.  I couldn't have been more pleased.  The folks there were great when I called about arriving late and the guy at the desk was very friendly and helpful.  I was really impressed with the room -- it was very clean, not upscale per se but nice and spacious.  I will definately choose the NCI on my return trips to Newport Beach.  Nice people, clean place, spacious rooms... I don't normally review places but left and thought, they deserve a great review so...here it is!
